Abnormal widening of the metaphyseal regions of long bones.
Abnormality of the wrist, the structure connecting the hand and the forearm.
Metaphyseal cupping refers to an inward bulging of the metaphyseal profile giving the metaphysis a cup-like appearance.
Underdevelopment of the ulna.

english_term: Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures
english_description: Curvature of the shafts of the long bones due to multiple fractures.
Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphyses.
One or more abnormally short long bone.
Shortening of the middle parts of the limbs (forearm and lower leg) in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
Bending of the diaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.
An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
Increase in size of one or more joints.
Underdevelopment of the fibula.
An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the humerus.
Dislocation of the distal humerus out of the elbow joint, where the radius, ulna, and humerus meet.
An abnormality of the shoulder, which is defined as the structures surrounding the shoulder joint where the humerus attaches to the scapula.
Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.
Abnormality of the patella (knee cap).
Partial dislocation of the head of the radius.
Abnormal increase in size of one or more metaphyses.
Amelia of all four limbs.
An abnormality of the humerus (i.e., upper arm bone).
Underdevelopment of the patella.
Reduced ability to extend (straighten) the knee joint.

An anomaly related to partial closure, or failure of development of the ulnar side of the distal radial growth plate, which results in an arrest of epiphyseal growth of the medial and volar portions of the distal radius. This leads to shortening of the radius and relative overgrowth of the ulna.
Abnormal flatness (decreased height) of epiphyses.
An abnormally increased calcium concentration in the blood.
Reduction in the concentration of albumin in the blood.
An increased concentration of glucose in the blood.
A decreased concentration of protein in the blood.
An increased concentration of glucose in the urine.
An elevated lipid concentration in the blood.

english_term: Defective DNA repair after ultraviolet radiation damage
chinese_term: 紫外线辐射后DNA损伤修复缺陷

english_description: An increased concentration of 4-hydroxy-L-proline in the urine.
An increased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint.
An increased tendency to fractures of the long bones (Mainly, the femur, tibia, fibula, humerus, radius, and ulna).
Disproportionately long fibulae.
Small hands and feet.

english_term: Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
chinese_term: 股骨近端骨骺发育不全
english_description: Underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
Trophic changes occurring in a limb.
Limitation of the extension of the hip, i.e., decreased ability to straighten the hip joint and thereby increase the angle between torso and thigh; moving the thigh or top of the pelvis backward.
An abnormal shortening of the femur.
Relatively increased growth of the fibula compared to that of the tibia.
Reduced diameter of a long bone.
An abnormal increase in the carrying angle, which is the angle he long axis of the extended forearm as it lies lateral to the long axis of the arm.
An abnormality of compact bone (also known as cortical bone), which forms the dense surface of bones.

english_term: Protuberances at ends of long bones
english_description: The presence of multiple protuberances (bulges, or knobs) at the ends of the long bones.

Loss of bone mass occurring beneath the periosteum (the periosteum is the connective-tissue membrane that surrounds all bones except at the articular surfaces). This process may create a serrated and lace-like appearance in periosteal cortical bone.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of cholesterol in the blood circulation.
An increased concentration of glycine in the urine.
An increased excretion of phosphates in the urine.
An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.
Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.
An abnormally decreased chloride concentration in the blood.
Abnormal rhythm of the heart.
An abnormality detectable by sonography of the heart (echocardiography).
An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the blood.

Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of a lipid in the blood circulation.
A contrqacture (chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin) that prevent normal movement of one or more joints of the limbs.
An increased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.
Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD).
An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the urine.
An abnormal buildup of lactic acid in the body, leading to acidification of the blood and other bodily fluids.
An abnormality of the myelination of motor and sensory peripheral nerves. These are axons for motor nerves and dendrites for sensory nerves in the strict anatomic sense.
An increased concentration of cystine in the urine.

An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract, the anterior spinocerebellar tract, and the posterior spinocerebellar tract.
An abnormality of the conduction of electrical impulses by peripheral (motor or sensory) nerves. This finding is elicited by a nerve conduction study (NCS).
An increased concentration of proline in the urine.
An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood.

chinese_term: 全丙种球蛋白减少血症
english_description: A reduction in the circulating levels of all the major classes of immunoglobulin. is characterized by profound decreases in all classes of immunoglobulin with an absence of circulating B lymphocytes.
An elevated concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

chinese_term: 血清5-羟色胺（血清素）水平升高
english_description: A increased concentration of serotonin in the blood.
Decreased concentration of adenosylcobalamin. Adenosylcobalamin is one of the active forms of vitamin B12.
An decreased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.
An abnormally high level of uric acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the urine.
An elevated urinary concentration of cystathionine.

chinese_term: 血促肾上腺皮质激素（ACTH）水平升高
english_description: An abnormal increased in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.
Abnormally increased serum levels of alkaline phosphatase activity.
An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine.
Increased excretion of oxalates in the urine.

english_term: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin
chinese_term: 血清转铁蛋白的等电位聚焦异常
english_description: Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.

chinese_term: 尿δ-氨基乙酰丙酸水平升高
english_description: An increased concentration of 5-aminolevulinic acid (CHEBI:17549) in the urine.

chinese_term: 下丘脑促性腺激素释放激素缺乏症
血甲状旁腺激素水平升高
english_description: An abnormal increased concentration of parathyroid hormone.
Increased concentration of taurine in the urine.
An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.
An anomaly of the the pubic bone, i.e., of the ventral and anterior of the three principal components (publis, ilium, ischium) of the hip bone.
Underdevelopment of the pubis, which together with the ilium and the ischium, is one of the three bones that make up the hip bone.
Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.
A shift from the normally round (convex) appearance of the iliac wing towards a square-like appearance.
Intrapelvic bulging of the medial acetabular wall.

Flattening of the superior part of the acetabulum, which is a cup-shaped cavity at the base of the hipbone into which the ball-shaped head of the femur fits. The acetabular roof thereby appears horizontal rather than arched, as it normally does.
Abnormally increased width of the pubic symphysis is the midline cartilaginous joint uniting the superior rami of the left and right pubic bones.
Reduced ability to move the femur outward to the side.

The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a reduction in the height of the notch.
The presence of nipples that instead of pointing outward are retracted inwards.
Underdevelopment of the breast.
Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased length from the nasal root to the nasal base.
The presence of a notch in the margin of the ala nasi.
It is characterized by one or more symptoms including sneezing, itching, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea.
Decreased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose.
Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations below the mean, or alternatively, an apparently decreased length from the nasal root to the nasal tip.
A disorder of muscle unrelated to impairment of innervation or neuromuscular junction.

An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.
Breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of muscle fiber contents (myoglobin) into the bloodstream.
The presence of skeletal muscular atrophy (which is also known as amyotrophy).

chinese_term: 四氮唑蓝（NBT）还原试验阴性
english_description: In the NBT test, neutrophils change the colorless compound NBT into a compound with a deep blue color. If this test is negative (i.e., no blue color is produced), then this indicates a defect in superoxide-generating NADPH oxidase activity with inability to efficiently kill phagocytized bacteria.

english_term: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
chinese_term: 自体荧光脂色素存储物质的胞内曲线堆积
english_description: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a curved pattern.

english_term: Fingerprint intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
chinese_term: 自体荧光脂色素存储物质的细胞内堆积指纹谱
english_description: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a trabecular or fingerprint-like pattern.

chinese_term: 丙酮酸羧化酶活性降低
english_description: A decreased rate of pyruvate carboxylase activity.

chinese_term: 甲基丙二酰辅酶A变位酶活性降低
english_description: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity.
An abnormally increased overall level of immunoglobulin E in blood.

english_term: Deficient excision of UV-induced pyrimidine dimers in DNA
chinese_term: 紫外线引起的DNA分子中嘧啶二聚体的切除缺陷

english_term: Prolonged G2 phase of cell cycle

english_description: An increased concentration of dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

chinese_term: 淀粉样物质的广泛沉积
english_description: A diffuse form of amyloidosis.
An increased concentration of glutamine in the blood.
An increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of ethylmalonic acid in the urine.
A type of chromosomal aberration characterised by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.

english_term: Chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents
chinese_term: 交联剂诱发的染色体断裂
english_description: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with DNA cross-linking agents such as diepoxybutane and mitomycin C.
Decreased concentration of methylcobalamin. Methylcobalamin is a form of vitamin B12.

english_term: Increased cellular sensitivity to UV light
chinese_term: 对紫外光的细胞敏感度增强

english_description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor V.

english_term: Rectilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
chinese_term: 自体荧光脂色素存储物质的直线性胞内堆积
english_description: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a straight or rectilinear pattern.
An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the blood.
An increased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.
An decreased concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
A decreased concentration of carnitine in the blood.
An increased concentration of methionine in the blood.

chinese_term: 血清肌酸磷酸激酶升高
english_description: An elevation of the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase, CPK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood. CPK levels can be elevated in a number of clinical disorders such as myocardial infarction, rhabdomyolysis, and muscular dystrophy.
An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin G in blood.
An increased concentration of phosphoethanolamine in the urine.

chinese_term: 磷酸核糖焦磷酸合成酶增高
english_description: Abnormally elevated level of the enzyme phosphoribosyl pyrophosphatesynthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of PP-ribose-P from ATP and ribose-5-phosphate.
Underdevelopment of part or all of the external reproductive organs.
Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.
Increased size of the ridge of tissue that extends along the midline of the scrotum.

english_term: Gonadal tissue inappropriate for external genitalia or chromosomal sex
chinese_term: 性腺组织与外生殖器或染色体性别不相配

english_description: Aplasia of the vagina.

chinese_term: 凝血因子级联反应异常
english_description: An abnormality of the coagulation cascade, which is comprised of the contact activation pathway (also known as the intrinsic pathway) and the tissue factor pathway (also known as the extrinsic pathway) as well as cofactors and regulators.
An increased amount of creatinine in the blood.
An increased concentration of hydroxyproline in the blood.
An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin A in blood.
The presence in serum of antibodies against smooth muscle.

chinese_term: N-乙酰氨基葡萄糖胺-1-磷酸转移酶缺陷

english_description: A type of hyperbilirubinemia with neonatal onset.

chinese_term: 乳清苷5'磷酸苷脱羧酶活性降低
english_description: An abnormal decrease in orotidine 5'-phosphate decarboxylase level.
A increased concentration of arginine in the urine.

chinese_term: 嗜苏丹型脑白质营养不良

english_description: Distention of the abdomen.
Abnormal increased size of the viscera of the abdomen.
An abnormality of the hip bone.
Underdeveloped acetabulae.
Reduced side to side width of the pelvis.
A benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface of the pelvis. Exostoses are capped by cartilage, and arise from a bone that develops from cartilage.
An abnormally squared appearance of the bony pelvis, a normally rounded or basin-shaped structure.
Widening of the femoral head and neck.
Increased concentration of ferritin in the blood circulation.
Abnormally reduced serum levels of alkaline phosphatase.
An increased concentration of cystathionine in the blood.
A functional anomaly of mitochondria.
A decreased concentration of leptin in the blood.
An increased concentration of threonine in the urine.
An increased concentration of lysine in the urine.
The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin.
When viewed in lateral radiographs, vertebral bodies have a roughly rectangular configuration. This term applies if the vertebral body appears rounded or oval.
An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.
Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the vertebra.
Spondylolysis is an osseous defect of the pars interarticularis, thought to be a developmental or acquired stress fracture secondary to chronic low-grade trauma.
Congenital synostosis between two or more adjacent vertebrae (partial or complete fusion of adjacent vertabral bodies).
Reduced ability to move the vertebral column with a resulting limitation of neck and trunk flexion.
Abnormally increased cuvature (anterior concavity) of the lumbar or cervical spine.
A partial dislocation of one or more intervertebral joints in the cervical vertebral column.
Abnormality of the dens of the axis, which is also known as the odontoid process.
Developmental hypoplasia of the dens of the axis.

english_term: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
english_description: Abnormal morphology of vertebral body.

A butterfly vertebra (sagittal cleft vertebra or anterior rachischisis) is a sagittal defect in the vertebral body caused by failure of fusion of the two lateral chondrification centers during embryogenesis. The name is based on the appearance of the two hemivertebrae emerging as butterfly wings from the central cleft on x-ray.
Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.
A partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joints.
Generalized weakness or decreased strength of the muscles, affecting both distal and proximal musculature.
Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis.
Pain in muscle.
Reduced strength of the axial musculature (i.e., of the muscles of the head and neck, spine, and ribs).

english_term: Hair shafts flattened at irregular intervals and twisted through 180 degrees about their axes
chinese_term: 毛干不规则扁平分布并绕发轴180度扭转

english_description: Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton.

chinese_term: 原发性干骺端松质缺如
血清β-氨基己糖苷酶增高

english_description: An abnormal increase in catecholamine concentration in the blood.
An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage.

The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.

chinese_term: 嘧啶反应性巨幼细胞性贫血
english_description: A type of megaloblastic anemia that improves upon administration of pyrimidine supplements such as uridylic acid and cytidylic acid.

english_term: Subepidermal blistering with cleavage in the lamina lucida
chinese_term: 表皮下水疱伴透明层裂隙
english_description: The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin.

chinese_term: 谷胱甘肽合成酶缺乏症
english_description: Reduced level of the enzyme glutathione synthetase, which catalyzes the last step in the synthesis of glutathione and a deficiency results in low levels of glutathione. Acidosis is due to reduced feedback inhibition of gamma-glutamyl cysteine synthetase in the gamma-glutamyl cycle, which ultimately leads to overproduction and accumulation of 5-oxoproline.

chinese_term: 尿去甲肾上腺素浓度增高
english_description: An increased concentration of noradrenaline in the urine.

chinese_term: 植物血凝素淋巴细胞转化受损
english_description: Normal peripheral blood lymphocytes, when stimulated by phytohemagglutinin (PHA) are cytotoxic for homologous and heterologous cells but not for autologous cells in monolayer culture. The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.
An increased concentration of alanine in the blood.
A reduction in the rate of cholesterol esterification.
An decreased level of renin in the blood.

english_term: Endopolyploidy on chromosome studies of bone marrow
chinese_term: 骨髓染色体的核内多倍性检查
english_description: An increase in the number of chromosome sets per cell in bone marrow cells.
An abnormality of amino acid metabolism characterized by a decreased level of propionyl-CoA carboxylase.
An increased concentration of threonine in the blood.
An increased concentration of an amino acid in the urine.
A reduction in the level of thymic horomone.
An increased concentration of cystine within cells. This finding can be demonstrated on leukocytes, but is not specific to blood cells.
Decreased concentration of sulfate in the urine.

chinese_term: 循环系统内的极低密度脂蛋白胆固醇浓度增高
english_description: An increase in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the viscera of the abdomen.
Joint pain affecting the hip.
An abnormal flattening of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

english_term: Enlargement of the proximal femoral epiphysis
english_description: An abnormal enlargement of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
A narrowing of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.

An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.
A pattern of simultaneous degeneration and regeneration of axons (see comment).

english_term: Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
chinese_term: 周围有髓神经纤维数量减少
english_description: A loss of myelinated nerve fibers in the peripheral nervous system (in general, this finding can be observed on nerve biopsy).

Repeated episodes of segmental demyelination and remyelination lead to the accumulation of supernumerary Schwann cells around axons, which is referred to as onion bulb formation. This finding affects peripheral nerves.
Atrophic changes of axons of the peripheral nervous system.

english_term: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
chinese_term: 大的周围有髓鞘神经纤维数量减少
english_description: A reduced number of large myelinated nerve fibers.
Increased susceptibility to fatigue.
An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.
A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs.
Wasting of thenar muscles, which are located on palm of the hand at the base of the thumb.
Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles.
Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

english_term: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction
chinese_term: 由于神经肌肉接头缺陷导致的广泛性肌张力减低

english_description: A type of onion bulb formation prominently affecting the area of the basal lamina.
Abnormal sensations such as tingling, pricking, or numbness of the skin with no apparent physical cause.
An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

english_term: EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
english_description: A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.

english_term: Distal sensory impairment of all modalities

chinese_term: 股骨近端干骺端不规则
english_description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the proximal metaphysis of the femur.
An anomaly of the atlantoaxial joint, i.e., of the joint between the first (atlas) and second (axis) cervical vertebrae.
Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.
An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.
Frontal schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the back.
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the lower back.
An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.

chinese_term: 胸腰段脊柱后侧凸畸形
中枢神经系统髓鞘形成减少
english_description: Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis.

chinese_term: 运动神经传导速度降低
english_description: A type of decreased nerve conduction velocity that affects the motor neuron.

chinese_term: 感觉性共济失调性神经病

english_description: An abnormal prolongation of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.
Absence of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can normally be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.
A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.

chinese_term: 肌电图:慢性失神经支配的征象
english_description: Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography.
The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials).
A reduction in the number of axons in the peripheral nervous system.

chinese_term: 感觉神经传导速度降低
english_description: Reduced speed of conduction of the action potential along a sensory nerve.

chinese_term: 冷刺激引起的肌肉痉挛
english_description: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures.
The presence of axonal regeneration following a previous axonal lesion.

english_term: Increased rate of premature chromosome condensation
chinese_term: 早熟染色体凝缩率增高
english_description: An increased rate of premature chromosome condensation.

chinese_term: 抗中性粒细胞抗体阳性
english_description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against neutrophils.
The presence in the serum of autoantibodies directed against thrombocytes.

english_term: Elevated circulating long chain fatty acid concentration
english_description: Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.

english_term: Low urinary cyclic AMP response to PTH administration
chinese_term: 尿环腺苷酸对甲状旁腺素（PTH）治疗反应低下

english_description: Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG).
The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.
A heterogeneous increase in IgM immunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.
Undetectable serum immunoglobulin A level at a value < 5 mg/dL (0.05 g/L).
Excretion of peptides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

chinese_term: 神经元外自体荧光脂褐素增加
english_description: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

english_term: Paradoxical increased cortisol secretion on dexamethasone suppression test
chinese_term: 地塞米松抑制试验皮质醇分泌反常增加

english_description: Abnormally increased movement at the junction between the first cervical (atlas) and the second cervical (axis) vertebrae as a result of either a bony or ligamentous anomaly.
An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.
Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths. Dysmyelination is distinguished from demyleination where there is destruction or damage of previously normal myelination.

Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.
Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.
A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.
An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.

chinese_term: 节段性神经末梢脱髓鞘/髓鞘再生
english_description: A segmental pattern of demyelination and regeneration (remyelination) affecting peripheral nerves.

Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves, and fibrillation potentials.
Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.
An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.
The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.
Cellular accumulation of GM2 gangliosides.
An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin M in blood.
A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to differing extents.
A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.
A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to a comparable extent.
A severe degree of short stature, more than -4 SD from the mean corrected for age and sex.

english_term: Deficiency or absence of cytochrome b(-245)

chinese_term: 出生身长大于97百分位数
不成比例的短躯干性矮小
english_description: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs.

chinese_term: 甲硫氨酸合成酶活性降低
english_description: A reduction in methionine synthase activity.
Formation of crystals owing to an increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.

english_term: Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular calcium reabsorption
chinese_term: 非甲状旁腺激素依赖性肾小管钙重吸收增加
english_description: An increase in the reabsorption of calcium by the renal tubulus that is not associated with increased parathormone levels.
An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the blood.
An increased concentration of ornithine in the urine.
Decreased level of acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (ADH). ADH and alcohol dehydrogenase (ALDH) are the primary enzymes involved in alcohol metabolism.

chinese_term: 黄嘌呤脱氢酶活性降低
english_description: An abnormal reduction in xanthine dehydrogenase level.
An increased amount of 3-methylglutaconic acid in the urine.

chinese_term: 延胡索酸水解酶活性降低
english_description: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of fumarate hydratase activity.
An abnormally low level of uric acid in the blood.

chinese_term: 血清艾杜糖醛硫酸酯酶活性增高
english_description: An increased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood.

An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.
Excretion of glycosaminoglycan in the urine. Glycosaminoglycans are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit.
An increased concentration of pyruvate in the blood.
A functional motor deficit where individuals whose responses to the challenges of exercise fail to achieve levels considered normal for their age and gender.

The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.

english_term: Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria
chinese_term: 肌膜下形态异常的线粒体沉积
english_description: An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.
Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).

chinese_term: 主要累及下肢的淋巴水肿
english_description: Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system, affecting mainly the legs.
Reduced ability to climb stairs.
A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.
Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.

english_term: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
chinese_term: 肌纤维直径变异性增大
english_description: An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.

chinese_term: 病毒感染诱导的横纹肌瘤
english_description: Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection.

The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.

chinese_term: 出生身长小于第3百分位数

english_description: An decreased concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
The presence of a folate sensitive fragile site at chromosome Xq28.

An increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The ESR is a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen.
An increased concentration of prostaglandin E2 in the blood.

chinese_term: 葡萄糖磷酸异构酶活性降低
english_description: A decreased level of glucose-6-phosphate isomerase.
Absence of molybdenum cofactor(2-), a cofactor for enzymes including sulfite oxidase, xanthine oxidoreductase, and aldehyde oxidase.
A decreased concentration of citrulline in the blood.
Increased concentration of total (conjugated and unconjugated) bilirubin in the blood.

chinese_term: 酚妥拉明阻断试验阳性
english_description: A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.

chinese_term: 细胞内钠离子浓度增高
english_description: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the cytosol.
A phenotypic abnormality that is present at birth.
Onset of disease manifestations in adulthood, defined here as at the age of 16 years or later.
A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms after the age of 60 years.
Gradual, very slow onset of disease manifestations.
Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life.
A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms at the age of 40 to 60 years.
Lack of urothione (the urinary metabolite of molybdenum cofactor) in the urine.
Increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.

english_term: Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies
english_description: The presence of foam cells that contain lamellar inclusion bodies.
If positive, the ferric chloride test indicates an increased concentration of phenols in the urine or blood.
The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.
Increased concentration of trimethylamine in the urine.

chinese_term: 着丝粒异染色质的过早分离

english_description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between the age of 5 and 15 years.
Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 28 days of life.
Congenital lack of development of the muscles, which are then replaced by a mixture of dense fat and fibrous tissue.

english_term: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
chinese_term: 四肢皮下脂肪组织丢失
english_description: Loss (disappearance) of previously present subcutaneous fat tissue in arm or leg.
An increased concentration of adrenaline in the urine.

english_term: Foam cells in visceral organs and CNS
chinese_term: 内脏与中枢神经系统泡沫细胞

english_description: The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.

Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.
Abnormally reduced sulfite oxidase level.

chinese_term: 部分凝血活酶时间延长
english_description: Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.
Abnormally increased concentration of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.

chinese_term: 电子传递黄素蛋白 - 泛醌氧化还原酶缺陷
english_description: A deficiency of the electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase.
An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.

The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, where they ingest low-density lipoproteins and become laden with lipids, giving them a foamy appearance.
Recurring episodes of myoglobinuria, i.e., of the presence of myoglobin in the urine. This is usually a consequence of rhabdomyolysis, i.e., of the destruction of muscle tissue.

Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.

chinese_term: 双氢嘧啶脱氢酶活性降低
english_description: An abnormal reduction in dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (NADP+) level.

chinese_term: N-乙酰氨基葡萄糖转移酶II活性降低
english_description: An abnormality of glycoprotein metabolism related to a decreased level of alpha-1,6-mannosylglycoprotein 2-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity.

chinese_term: β-葡萄糖脑苷脂酶蛋白和活性降低
english_description: Reduced level of the enzyme beta-glucosidase, an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glucosylceramide into ceramide and glucose.
A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood.
The age group in which disease manifestations appear.
Applies to a disease manifestation that increases in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that worsens with age.
Applies to a disease manifestation that only slowly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.
Applies to a disease manifestation that quickly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.
Applies to a disease manifestation that does not increase in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that does not worsen with age.

chinese_term: 中央成核的骨骼肌纤维
english_description: An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells).

chinese_term: 细胞色素C氧化酶阴性肌肉纤维
english_description: An abnormally reduced activity of the enzyme cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue.
The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).
Reduced strength and weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.
Abnormal protrusion of the scapula away from the surface of the back.
Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occurring late in the clinical course.
Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles.
Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles.
A lack of strength of the proximal muscles.
Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.
Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion.
Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells (as opposed to hyperplasia, which refers to an increase in the number of muscle cells).
Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.
Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.
Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells in a generalized (not localized) distribution.
Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).
Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.

chinese_term: 肠道病毒皮肌炎综合征

english_description: Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).
Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).
Muscle hypertrophy affecting the thighs.

The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.
A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.
The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.
Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.
A mode of inheritance in which the severity of a disorder increases or the age of onset decreases as the disorder is passed from one generation to the next.

english_term: Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias
chinese_term: 偏向父系传递的遗传早现
english_description: A type of genetic anticipation observed predominantly upon transmission from affected males.
Cases of the disease in question occur without a previous family history, i.e., as isolated cases without being transmitted from a parent and without other siblings being affected.
Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.
An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.
Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.

english_term: Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers
english_description: The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers.
A reduced amount of fat tissue in the lowest layer of the integument. This feature can be appreciated by a reduced skinfold thickness.
Congenital underdevelopment of lymph vessels.

chinese_term: 扣击引起的快速滚动的肌肉收缩（PIRC）
english_description: Mechanical percussion (i.e., striking a muscle with a reflex hammer) leads to spreading waves of muscle contractions that begin proximally and spread laterally across the muscle.
Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.
A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.
Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep.
A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.
A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).
Episodes of muscle weakness.

Pulp calcifications may appear as punctate calcifications, irregular, roughly spherical mineralized masses in any part of the pulp. It may occur isolated or associated to calcifications elsewhere such as the carotid arteries and kidneys. The diagnosis pulp calcifications can be established using radiological studies.

A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.
Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.
Excessive production of saliva.
A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).
Decreased concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

english_term: Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions
chinese_term: 1 型和 2 型肌纤维微核心区域
english_description: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in type 1 and type 2 muscle fibers.
Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers.

chinese_term: β-淀粉样蛋白免疫反应性沉积

english_description: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of middle phalanx of toe.
Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.
Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.

Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.

english_term: Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction
chinese_term: 线粒体功能障碍引起的肌异常

english_description: An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.
An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the thoracic cavity.
Death within the first 28 days of life.
A variability of phenotypic features.
Death in during childhood, defined here as between the ages of 2 and 10 years.
Death of the fetus in utero after at least 20 weeks of gestation.
A variable severity of phenotypic features.
A situation in which mutation carriers do not show clinically evident phenotypic abnormalities.
A situation in which phenotypic abnormalities become evident with age.
A displacement or misalignment of the humerus with respect to the other bones of the should joint. Note that a subluxation is a partial dislocation.
A partial dislocation of the shoulder joint.

english_term: Abnormality of upper limb epiphysis morphology
Spurred metaphyses of the upper limbs

english_description: Increased width (breadth) of metaphyses of the arms.

english_term: Cortical diaphyseal thickening of the upper limbs

english_description: Missing humerus bone associated with congenital failure of development.
Clefting affecting the humerus.
A bending or abnormal curvature of the humerus.
The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the humeral epiphysis.

Fracture or fragmentation at the lateral portion of the metaphysis of a long bone. The radiographic appearance is that of a small corner of metaphysis separated from the metaphyseal edge by thin linear radiolucency. This feature can be observed in child abuse but fragmented appearance of the metaphysis or facture-like lesions can also be detected in the setting of certain skeletal dysplasias.

english_term: Cortical subperiosteal resorption of humeral metaphyses
chinese_term: 肱骨干骺端皮质骨膜下吸收

english_description: Flaring (increase of width with a splayed appearance) of the humeral metaphysis.

english_term: Abnormality of the joint spaces of the elbow
Abnormality of the epiphyses of the elbow

english_description: Missing radius bone associated with congenital failure of development.
Missing ulna bone associated with congenital failure of development.
Increased length of the ulna.
Reduction in diameter of the ulna.
Increased width of the ulna.
An injury of the wrist with displacement of any of the eight carpal bones.
The distal epiphysis (rounded portion of bone at the far end of the radius distal to the growth plate) has an abnormal cone-shaped appearance.
Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the radius.
Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the ulna.
The total absence of the hand, with no bony elements distal to the radius or ulna.
Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.
Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a "mitten" hand deformity.
Wrist is bent inward toward the thumb because of a congenital defect associated with shortening or absence of the radius.

A hand in which the fingers are of nearly equal length and deflected at the first interphalangeal joint, so as to give a forklike shape consisting of separation of the first and second as well as the third and fourth digits.

Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. A deviation of a finger can be caused by an abnormal form of one or more of the phalanges of the affected finger, or by a deviation or displacement of one or more phalanges.

Significant increase in the length and girth of most or all of a digit compared to its contralateral digit (if unaffected) or compared to what would be expected for age/body build. The increased girth is accompanied by an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension AND the lateral dimension of the digit.
An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.
This term groups together three conditions that presumably represent different degrees of severity of a midline defect of the nose or nasal tip.

english_term: Short distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
english_description: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the third finger.
Clinodactyly refers to a bending or curvature of the fifth finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).
Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.

english_term: Short middle phalanx of the 5th finger
english_description: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the fifth finger.

english_term: Short distal phalanx of the 5th finger
english_description: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the fifth finger.
Congenital absence of a carpal bone.
The presence of more than the normal number of carpal bones.
Ossification of carpal bones at an abnormally early age.
Carpal bones with irregular or fragmented margins.
Point-shaped (punctate) calcifications affecting the carpal bones.
An anomaly of trapezium.

english_term: Narrow small joints of the hand
Osteoarthritis of the small joints of the hand
chinese_term: 手的小关节的骨关节炎

english_description: Short palm.

For children from birth to 4 years of age, the palm width is more than 2 SD below the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is below the 5th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately narrow for its length.
An abnormality of the gastric mucous membrane.
The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.
The presence of a hernia in the abdominal wall.

Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.
Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.
An abnormality of the endocardium.
An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.
An abnormality of macrophages.
A reticulocyte abnormality.
An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.
An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in blood.
Abnormally reduced levels of aldosterone.
The presence of a fistula of the vagina.

A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).
Abnormally increased body weight.
Abnormally low body weight.
Severe weight loss, wasting of muscle, loss of appetite, and general debility related to a chronic disease.
Any structural anomaly of the vitreous body.
An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
An abnormality of lymphocytes.

The presence of foam cells in the bone marrow, generally demonstrated by bone-marrow aspiration or biopsy. Foam cells have a vacuolated appearance due to the presence of complex lipid deposits, giving them a foamy or soap-suds appearance.
Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.
The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.
Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.
An abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism.

Defects in the lysosomal glycosidases or specific co-activators, result in accumulation of the substrates, such as glycosphingolipids, including gangliosides in GM1 gangliosidosis (Tay-Sachs disease) and GM2 gangliosidosis (Sandhoff disease).

Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles.

This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.
A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation.
Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.
A deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid in the blood circulation.
An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.

An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach's) and submucosal (Meissner's) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of tryptophan in the blood circulation.
An abnormality of temperature homeostasis.
A type of dystonia that is localized to a specific part of the body.

Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nervous system.
Neoplasms located in the blood and blood-forming tissue (the bone marrow and lymphatic tissue).
Abnormality of the anal canal.
An abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level.
Deposition of calcium salts in the aortic valve.
A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.
Abnormal calcification of the mitral valve.
Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.
Inflammation of the alimentary part of the gastrointestinal system.
An inflammation of the colon and small intestine. However, most conditions are either categorized as Enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or Colitis (inflammation of the large intestine).
A colon of abnormally small caliber.

A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.

Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.
A kind of congenital defect of the anterior abdominal wall in which the intestines are evident through the thin, lax, and protruding abdominal wall in affected infants.
A deficiency in the intake of energy and nutrients.
A reduced desire to eat.
Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.
An ulcer of the gastrointestinal tract.
Congenital atresia of the pylorus.
Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.

english_term: Abnormality of the sense of smell
english_description: An anomaly in the ability to perceive and distinguish scents (odors).
A decreased sensitivity to odorants (that is, a decreased ability to perceive odors).
Positioning of the nasal septum to the right or left in contrast to the normal midline position of the nasal septum.
An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.
An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial occlusive disease. After having walked over a distance which is individually characteristic, the patients experience pain or cramps in the calves, feet or thighs which typically subsides on standing still.
Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.
Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.
A narrowing of the biparietal diameter (i.e., of the transverse distance between the protuberances of the two parietal bones of the skull).
A forehead with abnormal flatness.

An abnormality of the cheek- one of two bilateral soft tissue facial structures in the region of the face inferior to the eyes and between the nose and the ear. "Buccal" means relating to the cheek. The cheek is part of the midface

This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.
Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.
A combined immunodeficiency primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.
An immunodeficiency defined by the absent or suboptimal functioning of one of the complement system proteins.
A lasting absence of total IgG and total IgA and total IgM in the blood circulation, whereby at most trace quantities can be measured.

Deficiency of secretory IgA (polymers of 2-4 IgA monomers are linked by two additional chains) and is the primary antibody response at the mucosal level, where it forms immune complexes with pathogens and allergens.
A reduced level of the complement component C8 in circulation.
Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.
Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the frontal bone.
A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.
Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.
A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.
A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture.
The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped.
The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear.
The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.
The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes.

Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.
A groove of the skin immediately in front of the ear.
A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).

english_term: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
english_description: An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).
A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.
The presence of a dilated inner part of external acoustic meatus.

english_term: Exostosis of the external auditory canal
english_description: A benign bony growth projecting outward from a bone surface within the external auditory canal.
Lack of measurable response to stimulation of auditory evoked potentials.
Benign congenital lesion of the postauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

chinese_term: 脑干听觉诱发电位延长

english_description: Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear.

An abnormality of the C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage, normally 16 to 20 in number, that occupy the anterior two-thirds of the circumference of the trachea (the posterior portion of the ring is completed by fibrous and smooth muscle tissue).
Chronic inflammation of the bronchi.

english_term: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
chinese_term: 先天性头顶部表皮发育不全
english_description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.
Hyperostosis (bony overgrowth) of the mandible.
The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age.
The progressive development of an abnormally large skull.

A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.
Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face.
Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve.

An abnormality of head shape characterized by the presence of a short, wide head as well as a pointy or conical form of the top of the head owing to premature closure of the coronal and lambdoid sutures.
The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.
Excessive growth of the calvaria.
An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms.
An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.
Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.

english_term: Chronic rhinitis due to narrow nasal airway

english_description: Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).
Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells.
Increased length of the hairs of the eyebrows.
Reduced or lacking hair growth in the temporal region (i.e., around the temples on the side of the skull).

english_term: Large clumps of pigment irregularly distributed along hair shaft
chinese_term: 沿发干不规则分布大片色素

english_description: Reduced or lacking hair growth in a generalized distribution.
Excessive, increased hair growth located in the sacral region.
A confluent, generalized overgrowth of silvery blonde to gray lanugo hair at birth.
Generalized excessive, abnormal hairiness.
A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates affecting the cervical spine.
Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).
Bulbous appearance of the anterior vertebral bodies, such that the vertebral bodies have the greatest vertical height anteriorly as well as bulbous anterior superior-inferior contours.
Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies.
Increased top to bottom height of vertebral bodies.
An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T11 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.
Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.
A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the thoracic spine.

english_term: Hump-shaped mound of bone in central and posterior portions of vertebral endplate
chinese_term: 椎体终板中后部骨质驼峰状凸起

english_description: Three ossification sites are present in typical vertebral bodies (C3-L5): a single ossification center in the vertebral body, and one each in the two neural arches. This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine.

english_term: Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies

english_description: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.
A lack of bone mineralization of the vertebral bodies.
A lack of ossification of the vertebral bodies.

english_term: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae
chinese_term: 胸椎下部前缘鸟喙样凸出
english_description: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the lower thoracic vertebral bodies.
Anterior mislocalization of the dens of the axis.
A discontinuity of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.
Butterfly vertebrae have a cleft through the body of the vertebrae and a funnel shape at the ends.
Increased size of the vertebral pedicle.
A progressive form of decreased height of the intervertebral disk.
Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.
Reduced size of cervical vertebrae.
Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies.

english_term: Decreased cervical spine flexion due to contractures of posterior cervical muscles
chinese_term: 颈后肌群挛缩致颈椎屈度下降

english_description: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of cervical vertebrae during development.
Over curvature of the lower thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.
Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.
An elevation of alpha-feto protein measured in the amniotic fluid.
Underdevelopment of the nasal bone.
Underdevelopment of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).
Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the midline region of the face.
A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions.

chinese_term: 跖部深在皱褶纵向分布
english_description: Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot.
Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.
Underdevelopment of the Third metatarsal bone leading to a short (hypoplastic) third metatarsal bone.
Short fourth metatarsal bone.
An abnormal thickening of the Achilles tendon.
Syndactyly with fusion of toes two and three.
Syndactyly with fusion of toes four and five.
The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the calcaneus.
Short (hypoplastic) fifth metatarsal bone.
An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal orientation of the kidney.
An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal axial orientation of the kidney.
An increase in amplitude of waves returned in ultrasonography of the kidney, which is generally displayed as increased brightness of the signal.
Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM), reflecting an increase in thickness (subjective estimate) of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.
The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.
A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum.
Cysts of microscopic size confined to the cortex of the kidney.

A developmental anomaly in which the kidneys are fused and localized on the same side of the midline. This anomaly is thought to result from disruption of the normal embryologic migration of the kidneys.

Obliteration of the glomerular capillary lumen by increased collagenous matrix, with or without hyalinosis or foam cells. Sclerosis involves 100% of the glomerular tuft. Relative to other patent glomeruli in the sample, glomerular size is preserved, or increased/decreased by no more than 50%.
An abnormality of the renal collecting system.

chinese_term: 慢性肾小管间质性肾炎
english_description: Chronic inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

chinese_term: 肾小球内皮下电子致密沉积物
english_description: Electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane,

A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.
Episodes of ventricular tachycardia that have a sudden onset and ending.
AF that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.
Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.
A tachycardia originating in the ventricles characterized by rapid heart rate (over 100 beats per minute) and broad QRS complexes (over 120 ms).
Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously.

chinese_term: 劳力诱导型多形性室性心动过速
english_description: Polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias of varying morphologythat do not exist under resting conditions but appear only upon physical exercise or catecholamine administration.

chinese_term: 血管成形术后冠状动脉再狭窄

english_description: Underdevelopment or reduced size of the heart right ventricle, often due to a reduced number of cells.

chinese_term: 阵发性室上性心动过速
english_description: An episodic form of supraventricular tachycardia with abrupt onset and termination.

chinese_term: 黏液瘤样二尖瓣退行性变
english_description: Myxomatous mitral valve is defined as the presence of excess leaflet tissue and leaflet thickening greater than 5 mm, resulting in a prolapse greater than 2 mm into the left atrium on parasternal long axis view.
Decreased number of head hairs per unit area on the anterior region of the scalp.
Fragile, easily breakable scalp hair.
Presence of multiple polyps in the duodenum.

The presence of multiple juvenile polyps in the stomach and intestine. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands. Juvenile polyps are a specific type of hamartomatous polyps.
An anatomical anomaly that results from an abnormal rotation of the gut as it returns to the abdominal cavity during embryogenesis.
Acute hepatitis complicated by acute liver failure with hepatic encephalopathy occurring less than 8 weeks after the onset of jaundice.
An inability to digest lactose.
Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus.
The presence of a fistula between the perineum and the rectum.
A deviation from the normal rotation of the midgut during embryologic development with mislocalization of the small bowel.
Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas located in the stomach.

english_term: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract
english_description: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract.
A form of hemolytic anemia that occurs in repeated episodes.
A form of hemolytic anemia with congenital onset.
A form of leukemia characterized by overproduction of an early myeloid cell.

chinese_term: 新生儿同种免疫性血小板减少症
english_description: Low platelet count associated with maternal platelet-specific alloantibodies.

chinese_term: 先天性发育不良性贫血
english_description: A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset.

chinese_term: 蚕豆诱发性溶血性贫血
english_description: A kind of hemolytic anemia that is induced by the ingestion of fava beans.
A form of hemolytic anemia that is triggered by ingestion of certain drugs.

chinese_term: 阵发性睡眠性血红蛋白尿症
正细胞发育不良性贫血
english_description: A type of hypoplastic anemia in which the erythrocytes have a normal cell volume (the mean corpuscular volume is within normal limits).

chinese_term: 急性粒单核细胞白血病
english_description: An acute leukemia characterized by the proliferation of both neutrophil and monocyte precursors.

chinese_term: 中性粒细胞核分叶过度
english_description: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil.
A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes.

chinese_term: 叶酸无反应型巨幼细胞性贫血
