A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism.
A kind of thyroid adenoma characterized by the presence of oxyphil cells.

chinese_term: 嗜酸性粒细胞恶性增殖

english_description: Underdevelopment of the paranasal sinuses.
Muscular dystrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle (the hips and shoulders).

english_term: Loss of ability to walk in first decade

chinese_term: 脊髓前角细胞形态异常
english_description: Any anomaly of the anterior horn cell.
Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the white matter of the central nervous system.

english_term: White mater abnormalities in the posterior periventricular region
chinese_term: 后部脑室周围区域白质异常

english_description: A type of focal clonic seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking rapidly involves one side of the body at seizure onset.

chinese_term: 小脑蚓部发育缺陷/发育不全
english_description: Absence or underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

A form of lissencephaly in which the cortex is thickened and has four more or less disorganized layers rather than six normal layers resulting from incomplete neuronal migration during brain development. At neuropathological examination, a 4-layered cortex consists of an upper molecular layer, a second thin cellular layer containing pyramidal neurons usually observed in layer V, a third pale poorly cellular layer and a fourth thick deep layer made up of neurons which had failed to migrate. Radiologocally would manifest as agyria or pachygyria with cortical thickness greater than 10 mm.
A type of polymicrogyria with a gradient of severity (anterior more severe than posterior) extending from frontal poles posteriorly to precentral gyrus and inferiorly to frontal operculum.

english_term: Pallor of dorsal columns of the spinal cord

english_description: A severe degree of muscular hypotonia characterized by markedly reduced muscle tone.

english_term: Developmental stagnation at onset of seizures
chinese_term: 癫痫发病后的发育停滞
english_description: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills, following the onset of epilepsy.
A type of Horner syndrome with congenital onset.
Absence of the knee jerk reflex, which can normally be elicited by tapping the patellar tendon with a reflex hammer just below the patella.
Underdevelopment of the ventral portion of the pons.

chinese_term: 对称的脊神经根神经纤维瘤
english_description: Multiple neurofibromas of the spinal nerve roots with a symmetric distribution.

chinese_term: 发作性全身肌张力减退
english_description: The occurrence of repeated episodes of generalized muscular hypotonia.
Wasting (atrophy) of the vermis of cerebellum.
A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position occuring at distal joints.

chinese_term: 严重的表达性语言发育延迟
english_description: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

chinese_term: 中线中枢神经系统脂肪瘤

english_description: A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally.
Underdevelopment of the cerebrum.

chinese_term: 对称的进行性周围神经脱髓鞘
english_description: A symmetric and progressive loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.
Atrophy affecting the pons and the cerebellum.
A hemangioblastoma of the cerebellum.
A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the distal portions of the limbs.
The term progressive intellectual disability should be used if intelligence decreases/deteriorates over time.
Borderline intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 70-85.
Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the frontotemporal cerebrum.
Fleeting perceptual experiences that occur during the transition from sleep to wakefulness.

Malfunction of the abducens nerve as manifested by impairment of the ability of the affected eye to be moved outward. Patients who develop abducens nerve palsy often present with binocular horizontal diplopia, which is a double vision when looking at objects side by side. There will be a notable weakness of the ipsilateral lateral rectus muscle leading to a deficit in of eye abduction on the affected side. Some patients may present with a constant head turning movement to maintain binocular fusion and to lessen the degree of diplopia.
Atrophy of the frontal cortex.

english_term: Intraaxonal accumulation of curvilinear autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
chinese_term: 曲线性自体荧光脂色素存储物质的轴突内堆积增加
english_description: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material within axons.

english_term: Abnormal aggressive, impulsive or violent behavior
chinese_term: 异常的攻击、冲动或暴力行为

english_description: Stiffness (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) of the axial musculature.
Excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of one side of the brain.

Brain damage related to a lowering of blood glucose below a critical level (around 30 mg/dl), which may lead to confusion, lethargy and delirium followed by seizures and coma. Prolonged hypoglycemia may lead to irreversible brain damage.
The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cortex of frontal lobe and the cortex of parietal lobe.
Nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation) on the skin of the distal limbs. This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.
A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration at the ankles. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to the malleoli of the ankles.

chinese_term: 弥漫性海绵状白质脑病

english_description: A complete loss of the ability to perceive vibration.
An increased susceptibility to meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of meningitis.

chinese_term: 橄榄桥脑小脑发育不全
english_description: Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

An abnormality of the auditory evoked potentials, which are used to trace the signal generated by a sound, from the cochlear nerve, through the lateral lemniscus, to the medial geniculate nucleus, and to the cortex.
The presence of calcium deposition in the choroid plexus.

english_term: Gait instability, worse in the dark

chinese_term: 髓鞘障碍性脑白质营养不良

english_description: Any abnormal alteration of an individual's circadian rhythm that affects the timing of sleeping and being awake.
Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.
A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged.

Dysplasia and dysgenesis of the corpus callosum are nonspecific descriptions that imply defective development of the corpus callosum. The term dysplasia is applied when the morphology of the corpus callosum is altered as a congenital trait. For instance, the corpus callosum may be hump-shaped, kinked, or a striped corpus callosum that lacks an anatomically distinct genu and splenium.
Focal proliferation of glial cells in the basal ganglia.

english_term: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis
chinese_term: 小脑蚓部浦肯野细胞缺失

english_description: Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.
The formation of small cavities in the tissue of the basal ganglia.

An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of small muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Fine motor skills are required to mediate movements of the wrists, hands, fingers, feet, and toes.

Paralysis of the fourth cranial (trochlear) nerve manifested as weakness of the superior oblique muscle which causes vertical diplopia that is maximal when the affected eye is adducted and directed inferiorly.

An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of large muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Gross motor skills are required to mediate movements of the arms, legs, and other large body parts.

Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) manifests at age 2-3 years or by first grade at the latest. The main symptoms are distractibility, impulsivity, hyperactivity, and often trouble organizing tasks and projects, difficulty going to sleep, and social problems from being aggressive, loud, or impatient.
Inability to perceive painful stimuli.
Cerebral hemorrhage that occurs before birth.

Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.
A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.

Cerebellar dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) is defined by abnormal cerebellar foliation, white matter arborization, and gray-white matter junction. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome. Dysplasia may globally involve the cerebellum or affect only one cerebellar hemisphere. In addition, cerebellar dysplasia may be associated with cortical/subcortical cysts.

english_term: Symmetric lesions of the basal ganglia

chinese_term: 慢性淋巴细胞性脑膜炎
english_description: Meningitis that persists for more than 4 weeks, and lymphocytes are present in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
Partial or complete wasting (loss) of dentate nucleus.
Increased size of the basal ganglia.

chinese_term: 广泛性脑萎缩/发育不全
english_description: Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.

english_term: Aplasia of the inferior half of the cerebellar vermis
chinese_term: 小脑蚓部的下部发育缺陷

english_description: Progressive loss of previously present language abilities.

english_term: Disorganization of the anterior cerebellar vermis

chinese_term: 远端感觉性周围神经病变
english_description: Peripheral sensory neuropathy affecting primarily distal sensation.
Underdevelopment of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.
Increased vertical dimension of the corpus callosum. This feature can be visualized by sagittal sections on magnetic resonance tomography imaging of the brain.
Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

english_term: Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials
chinese_term: 感觉动作电位波幅降低
english_description: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.
An increase in size of the third ventricle.
Fasciculations affecting the tongue muscle and the musculature of the face.
Episodes of choreoathetosis that can occur following triggers such as quick voluntary movements.

english_term: Hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
english_description: A darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.

chinese_term: 体感诱发电位潜伏期延长

english_description: Encephalopathy with onset in the infantile period.
A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers from segments of the peripheral nervous system.
Demyelinating neuropathy is characterized by slow nerve conduction velocities with reduced amplitudes of sensory/motor nerve conduction and prolonged distal latencies.
Atrophy of the temporal cortex.
A particular type of dementia characterized by a pattern of mental defects consisting prominently of forgetfulness, slowness of thought processes, and personality or mood change.
Amyotrophy (muscular atrophy) affecting the proximal musculature.

chinese_term: 急性脱髓鞘性多发性神经病
english_description: Acute progressive areflexic weakness and mild sensory changes resulting from myelin breakdown and axonal degeneration.
Neurodegeneration involving the globus pallidus,a part of the basal ganglia that is involved in the regulation of voluntary movement.
Muscular atrophy of distal arm muscles.

chinese_term: 进行性锥体外系功能障碍
进行性锥体外系肌肉僵直
english_description: A progressive degree of muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

english_term: Diffuse demyelination of the cerebral white matter
english_description: A diffuse loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.
Episodic bouts of involuntary movements with dystonic, choreic, ballistic movements, or a combination thereof. There is no loss of consciousness during the attacks.
A complete lack of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

chinese_term: 外周神经髓鞘发育障碍
english_description: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the peripheral nervous system.

english_term: Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion
chinese_term: 基底节局灶性T2高信号病变
english_description: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.
A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure that affects a particular part of the cortex.
Facial diplegia (that is, bilateral facial palsy) with congenital onset.

english_term: Neuronal loss in the cerebral cortex
chinese_term: 大脑皮质中神经元损失
觉醒期双侧强直- 阵挛发作
english_description: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure of either generalized or focal onset occurring on or soon after wakening (typically within 90 minutes of waking, regardless of the time of day).
Atherosclerosis (HP:0002621) of a cerebral artery.

chinese_term: 偏侧巨脑/偏侧巨脑畸形
english_description: Enlargement of all or parts of one cerebral hemisphere.
Generalized-onset tonic-clonic seizures that are provoked by flashing or flickering light.
Presence of irregular redundant loops of focally folded myelin in a peripheral nerve.
Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve).
Muscular atrophy affecting the lower limb.
Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood.
Demyelination of peripheral motor nerves.
Increased size of cerebral gyri, often associated with a moderate reduction in the number of sulci of the cerebrum.
The presence of calcium deposition in the cerebral white matter surrounding the cerebral ventricles.

english_term: Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential
chinese_term: 远端感觉神经动作电位降低
english_description: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential in distal nerve segments. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

english_term: Spinocerebellar tract disease in lower limbs

english_description: Groups of small caliber axons in peripheral nerve biospies indicative of axonal regeneration.
A type of gait ataxia displaying progression of clinical severity.

english_term: Decreased number of small peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
chinese_term: 小的周围有髓鞘神经纤维数量减少

english_description: Functional neurological abnormalities related to dysfunction of the pyramidal tract.
A form of lissencephaly characterized by an uneven cortical surface with a so called 'cobblestone' appearace. There are no distinguishable cortical layers.

chinese_term: 对称性周围神经脱髓鞘
english_description: A symmetric loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.
Atrophy affecting the cerebellum and the spinocerebellar tracts of the spinal cord.
Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths of the white matter of the brain.
An abnormality characterized by chronic impairment of the normal functioning of the axons.
Muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

An atypical absence seizure is a type of generalised non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by interruption of ongoing activities and reduced responsiveness. In comparison to a typical absence seizure, changes in tone may be more pronounced, onset and/or cessation may be less abrupt, and the duration of the ictus and post-ictal recovery may be longer. Although not always available, an EEG often demonstrates slow (<3 Hz), irregular, generalized spike-wave activity.
An increased susceptibility to bacterial meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of bacterial meningitis.

english_term: Paucity of anterior horn motor neurons

english_description: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills.

english_term: Facial palsy secondary to cranial hyperostosis
chinese_term: 继发于颅骨增生的面神经麻痹
english_description: Paralysis of the facial nerves on the basis of overgrowth of the cranial bones causing impingement upon the seventh cranial nerve.
Fasciculations affecting the musculature of the arms and legs.
A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.

chinese_term: 皮质脊髓侧束功能障碍

english_description: A loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.
Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the deep cerebral white matter.
A type of dystonia that affects all or most of the body.

chinese_term: 脱髓鞘和轴突混合型多发性周围神经病

english_description: Reduced ability to perceive painful stimuli.

chinese_term: 局灶性单侧面部阵挛发作
english_description: Focal seizure characterized at onset by clonic movements affecting half of the face.
Underdevelopment of the frontal lobe of the cerebrum.

english_term: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset
english_description: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset is a focal-onset seizure which progresses into a bilateral tonic-clonic phase.
Recurrent episodes of brain dysfunction that may be triggered by factors such as metabolic disturbances or infections.
A saccade that overshoots the target with the dynamic saccade.
Weakness of the muscles of the legs.

english_term: Diffuse swelling of cerebral white matter
Abnormal morphology of the limbic system
english_description: Any structural anomaly of the limbic system, a set of midline structures surrounding the brainstem of the mammalian brain, originally described anatomically, e.g., hippocampal formation, amygdala, hypothalamus, cingulate cortex. Although the original designation was anatomical, the limbic system has come to be associated with the system in the brain subserving emotional functions. As such, it is very poorly defined and doesn't correspond closely to the anatomical meaning any longer. [BirnLex].
A type of tremors that is triggered by holding an arm in a fixed position.

A focal-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. They may be discretely localized or more widely distributed, and may originate in subcortical structures.

chinese_term: 小脑发育缺陷/发育不全

english_description: A structural abnormality of the pons.

chinese_term: 锥体束不发育/发育不全

english_term: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system
chinese_term: 影响中枢神经系统的萎缩/退化

english_description: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebrum, also known as the telencephalon, the largest and most highly developed part of the human brain.

chinese_term: 胼胝体发育缺陷/发育不全
english_description: Absence or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.
The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the corpus callosum.

chinese_term: 累及皮质脊髓束的萎缩/退化

english_description: Wasting involving the motor neuron.

chinese_term: 累及尾状核的萎缩/退化

english_description: An abnormality of the septum pellucidum, which is a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain.

An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the gastrointestinal tract.
Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face.

chinese_term: 先天性头皮表皮发育不全
english_description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.
Underdevelopment of the sweat glands.
Developmental hypoplasia of the apocrine sweat glands in the region of the axilla.
Well-demarcated area(s) of partial or complete depigmentation in the macula, reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss.

english_term: Areas of hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation that do not follow Blaschko lines
chinese_term: 不沿Blaschko线分布的色素减退和色素沉着区域
非表皮松解性掌跖角化症
english_description: Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles charactersized by hyperkeratosis of the stratum corneum with no evidence of epidermolysis characteristic of epidermolytic hyperkeratosis.

english_term: Excessive skin wrinkling on dorsum of hands and fingers
chinese_term: 手背和指背部皱褶过多

english_description: Increased susceptibility to infection by the protozan parasite of the genus Leishmania.
An abnormally increased perspiration on palms and soles.

chinese_term: 发育不全性皮脂腺缺如

english_description: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the forehead.

english_term: Neonatal wrinkled skin of hands and feet

english_description: Cutaneous lesion that develops as a dry, scaly, red patch that evolves to an indurated and hyperpigmented plaque with adherent scale. Scarring may result in central white patches (loss of pigmentation) and skin atrophy.
Loss of all scalp hair.
Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma.
Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the cheeks.

chinese_term: 口腔粘膜毛细血管扩张
english_description: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the oral mucosa.
The presence of two to five cafe-au-lait macules.
Generalized abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

chinese_term: 先天性鱼鳞病样红皮病
english_description: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.

chinese_term: 间歇性弥漫性红色斑丘疹
毛发-指甲型外胚层发育不良

english_description: The presence of multiple leiomyomas of the skin.

english_term: Mottled pigmentation of the trunk and proximal extremities
chinese_term: 躯干和四肢近端斑驳状色素沉着
色素沉着/色素减退斑（色素异常斑）
白点病；斑驳病；斑状白斑病；斑状白癜风；斑状白化病；
english_description: Absence of melanin pigment in various areas, which is found at birth and is permanent. The lesions are known as leucoderma and are often found on the face, trunk, or limbs.
A type of blistering that affects the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.
Diffuse abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles.
Prominent thoracic and abdominal veins.
Reduced number or density of facial hair.
Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles with an honeycomb pattern.
Increased amount of keratin (visible as white scales) surrounding hair follicles.
Cutis gyrata of palms and soles.
Subcutaneous nodules that are located in the vicinity of joints.

chinese_term: 先天性大疱性鱼鳞病样红皮病
english_description: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin that presents at birth or shortly thereafter with generalized erythema, blistering, erosions, and peeling. In the subsequent months, erythema and blistering improves but patients go on to develop hyperkeratotic scaling that is especially prominent along the joint flexures, neck, hands and feet.

chinese_term: 无汗性外胚层发育不良

english_description: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

chinese_term: 鱼鳞病样红皮病(大疱型)、大疱性鱼鳞病样角化过度症、显性遗传性先天性鱼鳞病、表皮松解性角化过度鱼鳞病
english_description: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

english_term: Decreased sweating due to autonomic dysfunction
chinese_term: 植物神经功能紊乱性少汗
皮肤色素脱失/色素沉着

english_description: Lack of subcutaneous adipose tissue.
Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) with a diffuse localization.

english_term: Linear arrays of macular hyperkeratoses in flexural areas
chinese_term: 弯曲部位线状分布的角化过度斑

english_term: Discrete 2 to 5-mm hyper- and hypopigmented macules
chinese_term: 散在分布的2至5mm大小的色素沉着/减退斑
摩擦所致的局部掌跖角化
english_description: Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot in areas exposed to friction.
Increased susceptibility to staphylococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of staphylococcal infections.
The presence of fewer than normal sweat glands.

english_term: Streaks of hyperkeratosis along each finger onto the palm
chinese_term: 掌侧沿手指分布的线状角化过度
克尔里病，贯穿性角化过度病
english_description: A skin condition characterized by excessive development of keratin in hair follicles, resulting in rough, cone-shaped, elevated papules resulting from closure of hair follicles with a white plug of sebum.

chinese_term: 斑片状色素减退和色素沉着

english_term: Edema of the dorsum of hands
english_description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the hands.
Loose and sagging skin of the fingers.
Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet.

english_term: Yellow subcutaneous tissue covered by thin, scaly skin
chinese_term: 由薄层鳞状皮肤覆盖的黄色皮下组织
有汗型外胚层发育不良

english_description: A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin.
Presence of a cutaneous lipoma on the forehead.

english_term: Absent pigmentation of the ventral chest
english_description: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the anterior chest.
Piebaldism is characterized by stable and persistent, well-circumscribed depigmented patches present at birth affecting the skin of the face, trunk, and extremities in a symmetrical distribution.
Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles that is present at birth.

english_term: Desquamation of skin soon after birth

chinese_term: 皮下脂肪组织分布异常

english_description: Hyperkeratosis affecting the sole of the foot.

chinese_term: 局部表皮松解性角化过度症

english_description: The presence of six or more cafe-au-lait spots.
Seborrheic dermatitis that is not localized to any one particular region.

chinese_term: 弥漫性青铜色色素沉着
持久斑疹性毛细血管扩张
非疤痕发疱性脆性皮肤

english_description: Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern.

english_term: Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs
chinese_term: 先天性躯干或四肢表皮发育不全
english_description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the trunk or the limbs.

english_term: Aplasia cutis congenita over posterior parietal area
chinese_term: 先天性后顶叶表皮发育不全

english_term: Aplasia/Hypoplastia of the eccrine sweat glands
chinese_term: 外分泌汗腺发育缺陷/不全
english_description: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands.
The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands.

chinese_term: 泛发性网状棕色色素沉着
少汗性外胚层发育不良

english_description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body because of decreased osmotic pressure of plasma (hypoproteinemia).
Deposition of calcium salts in subcutaneous tissue (i.e., the the lowermost layer of the integument).
The presence of leiomyoma of the skin.

chinese_term: 伸肌表面毛细血管扩张

english_description: Osteomyelitis of the lower jaw.
A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.

chinese_term: 非动脉炎性前部缺血性视神经病变
english_description: An acute condition characterized by sudden visual loss (usually discovered in the morning), optic disc edema at onset, optic disc-related visual field defects. Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy can be associated with flame hemorrhages on the swollen disc or nearby neuroretinal layer, and sometimes with nearby cotton-wool exudates.
A form of colorblindness in which only two of the three fundamental colors can be distinguished due to a lack of one of the retinal cone pigments.
A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.

chinese_term: 牵拉性周边视网膜脱离
english_description: Tractional retinal detachment at the periphery of the retina.
Lack of eyelashes on the lower lid.
A type of cataract with punctate opacities of the lens.

english_term: Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
chinese_term: 先天性视网膜色素上皮肥大
english_description: Sharply demarcated, congenital hyperpigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium.

english_term: Eversion of lateral third of lower eyelids
chinese_term: 下眼睑外侧三分之一外翻

english_description: A congenital defect of development characterized by absence of the lacrimal gland.
Opacity of the entire lens nucleus.

chinese_term: 视网膜上大色素沉着斑
脉络膜视网膜色素沉着异常

english_description: Abnormally curly or curved eyelashes.

Degenerative changes of the peripheral retina consisting of close-packed tiny cystic spaces at the outer plexiform/inner nuclear retinal level. The degeneration is very common in adult eyes and starts adjacent to the ora serrata and extends circumferentially and posteriorly.

An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.
Congenital underdevelopment of the iris.
Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula.
Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).
A functional abnormality of the pupil.
A unilateral form of ptosis.

chinese_term: 无法检测的明暗适应视网膜电图
english_description: Absence of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.

chinese_term: 地图点指纹角膜营养不良

english_description: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.
Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid.
Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin.

chinese_term: 阵发性不自主眼球运动
english_description: Sudden-onset episode of abnormal, involuntary eye movements.
Absence of the crystalline lens of the eye as a result of a developmental defect.
A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid).
A chronic irritative conjunctivitis, which commonly presents with general irritation and redness of the eyes, with a burning, dry, or foreign-body sensation of the eyes.

Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age.
Atrophy (loss or wasting) of the retinal pigment epithelium observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.
Lack of transparency of the corneal epithelium.
Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil of congenital onset.
An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.

chinese_term: 脉络膜视网膜发育不良
english_description: Abnormal development of the choroid and retina.
Underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.
Abnormally big lacrimal glands.

english_term: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
chinese_term: 骨针样视网膜色素沉着
english_description: Pigment migration into the retina in a bone-spicule configuration (resembling the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone).
Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.
Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.

chinese_term: 青少年型上皮性角膜营养不良

english_description: Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.
A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) that surrounds the central fixation point.
Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina.
Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased.
Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.
The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of retinal blood vessels (arteries, arterioles, veins, venules).
An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.
Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.
Underdevelopment of the ciliary body.

chinese_term: 视网膜后新生血管形成
english_description: A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the posterior pole of the retina.
A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens.
A type of cataract affecting the posterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule.

english_term: Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
chinese_term: 视网膜色素上皮斑状萎缩
english_description: Wasting (atrophy) of the retinal pigment epithelium present in small, isolated areas.
Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.
A cataract that affects the anterior part of the cortex of the lens.
The presence of whitish deposits in the conjunctiva resembling salt. May be related to calcinosis.

english_term: Increased axial length of the globe
english_description: Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean.

The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material.
Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray.
Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.

The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining.
A form of uveitis that is not associated with the formation of granulomas.

Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.

A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a horizontal direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone.
Presenile cataract is a kind of cataract that occurs in early adulthood, that is, at an age that is younger than usual.
Paralysis of both the extrinsic and intrinsic ocular muscles.
Inability to see well at night or in poor light with onset in adulthood.

chinese_term: 非进行性限制性眼外肌麻痹
english_description: Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.
A kind of cataract that progresses with age.
A progressive form of ptosis.

english_term: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
chinese_term: 玻璃体淀粉样蛋白沉积
english_description: Deposition of hyaline extracellular material (amyloid) into the vitreous humor, which can manifest as vitreous opacities and reduced visual acuity.
Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma.
Punched out lesions in the pigmented layer of the retina.
Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth.
Deposition of calcium salts in the retina.
The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas.

A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point.
Blindness with onset at birth.
An abnormally slow velocity of horizontal saccadic eye movements.
A type of posterior subcapsular cataract characterized by an iridescent color.
Underdevelopment of the lacrimal puncta.

Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).
Failure of attachment of the retina during development.
Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye.

chinese_term: 静脉旁脉络膜视网膜萎缩
english_description: Chorioretinal atrophy along the retinal veins.
Intraocular pressure that is 2 standard deviations above the population mean.
A type of of patterned retinal dystrophy that shows a reticular pattern of pigmentation.

chinese_term: 多形性后角膜营养不良
english_description: This corneal dystrophy affects the posterior limiting membrane of the cornea and is characterized by polymorphous plaques of calcium deposits in the deep stromal layers of the cornea, and occasionally by vesicular lesions of the endothelium and edema of the deep corneal stroma.

A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.

chinese_term: 视网膜神经纤维过度髓化

english_description: A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct.

chinese_term: 闪光视觉诱发电位异常
english_description: Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room.
Regional increase in the width (height) of the lateral eyebrow.

chinese_term: 青少年型后囊下晶体混浊

english_description: Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.
A type of retinal reticular pigmentation that forms a polygonal, netlike arrangement of hyperpigmented lines forming geometric patterns in the fundus.
A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors.
Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus.
A form of stapes ankylosis with congenital onset.
A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only.

chinese_term: 密集的后皮质性白内障
english_description: A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities.

chinese_term: 乳头旁脉络膜视网膜萎缩
english_description: Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).
A reduction of corneal clarity.

english_term: Optic atrophy from cranial nerve compression
chinese_term: 脑神经受压性视神经萎缩
退行性玻璃体视网膜病

english_term: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
english_description: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.
A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens.
The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina.
Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

Cerulean cataracts are a kind of congenital cataract having peripheral bluish and white opacifications in concentric layers with occasional central lesions arranged radially. Although the opacities may be observed during fetal development and childhood, usually visual acuity is only mildly reduced until adulthood, when lens extraction is generally necessary.
Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

A dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram in which the b-wave that is of markedly lower amplitude than the associated a-wave (source: Holder GE., Inherited Chorioretinal Dystrophies: A Textbook and Atlas; 2014; p.17; ISBN 978-3-540-69466-3).
Blockage of retinal arteriole, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to affected regions of the retina.
Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.
Retinal exudate within the retinal tissue itself.
Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.
Congenital malformation of the lacrimal duct associated with incomplete development of the bony nasolacrimal canal or craniofacial anomalies.
Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.

An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids.
Increased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.
Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation.
Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea.
Inherited progressive cone degeneration.
A form of macular degeneration characterized by the presence of multiple cysts in the macula.
A type of sutural cataract in which the opacity follows the posterior Y suture.
Abnormal pigmentation of the iris.

chinese_term: 反常性视网膜色素变性
english_description: Retinitis pigmentosa inversa is form of retinal degeneration characterized by areas of retinal/chorioretinal degeneration with pigment migration in the macular area (in contrast to retinitis pigmentosa which, at early disease stages, predominantly affects the retinal periphery).

english_term: Absent anterior chamber of the eye
english_description: Absence of the anterior chamber of the eye owing to a developmental defect.
Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.
Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.

chinese_term: 闪光视觉诱发电位增强

english_description: A structural abnormality of retinal vasculature.
An abnormality of an extraocular muscle.
An anomaly of the space between the medial and lateral canthi of the two open eyelids.
A wrinkle of retinal tissue projecting outward from the surface of the retina and visible as a line on fundoscopy.
Absence or underdevelopment of the iris.
Absence or underdevelopment of the lens.
An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization.
The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.
Reduced density of hairs.
Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.
Virilization (deepening of voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum.
An abnormally high concentration of serum conjugated estriol as compared to normal values for gestational-age.
The development of Pes cavus that is progressive with age.
Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially.
An outward deviation of the foot at the talocalcaneal or subtalar joint.

chinese_term: 第二-五趾中间趾骨发育不全

english_description: The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible.

english_term: Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone
english_description: An anomaly of the fifth metatarsal bone.
Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fourth toe.
An overall widening of the spaces between the digits.
Medial deviation of the second toe.

english_term: Expanded metatarsals with widened medullary cavities

english_description: Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

english_term: Plantar crease between first and second toes
chinese_term: 第一、二脚趾之间足底皱褶
english_description: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe.
Precocious (accelerated) maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
Osteosclerosis of the endosteal surface of the diaphyses (shafts) of the metatarsal bones.
Bending or curvature of a third toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
Limitation of the ability to bend the toes.
Synostosis of the calcaneus with the navicular bone.
A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus.
A two-part calcaneus, a finding that probably results from delayed coalescence of two primary calcaneal centers of ossification.
The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more tarsal bones.

english_term: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus

english_description: Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees.
Delayed maturation and calcification of the calcaneus.

chinese_term: 肾上腺素诱导的血小板聚集障碍
english_description: Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine.

chinese_term: 感染期血清转氨酶升高
english_description: Elevations of the levels of SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) that occur during infections.

Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The results of the prothrombin time test are often expressed in terms of the International normalized ratio (INR), which is calculated as a ratio of the patient's prothrombin time (PT) to a control PT standardized for the potency of the thromboplastin reagent developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) using the formula: INR is equal to Patient PT divided by Control PT.
Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.
Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.
Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia is defined as the combination of a normal low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol in the face of an increased LDL apolipoprotein B (apoB) protein.
An increase in the level of 3-hydroxydicarboxylic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood not associated with symptoms such as encephalopathy.
Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in the blood.
Reduced proportion of helper T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
Abnormally decreased rate of beta-galactosidase activity. Beta-galactosidase activity can be measured in leukocyte, fibroblast, or plasma.

english_term: Very long chain fatty acid accumulation

english_description: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VII. Factor VII is part of the extrinsic coagulation pathway, which is initiated at the site of injury in response to the release of tissue factor (fIII). Tissue factor and activated factor VII catalyze the activation of factor X.

chinese_term: 新生儿高非结合胆红素血症

english_description: An abnormal reduction in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.

chinese_term: 肌酸磷酸激酶轻度升高

english_description: An absence of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
The onset of puberty before the age of 9 years in boys.
The presence of large polyhedral cells with eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei in the adrenal cortex.
No secondary sexual characteristics are present at puberty.
Decreased sensitivity toward insulin.
The congenital absence of the thyroid gland.
The presence of multiple pancreatic islet cell adenomas.

chinese_term: 先天性甲状旁腺功能减退症
english_description: Deficiency of parathyroid hormone with congenital onset.

chinese_term: 原发性甲状旁腺功能亢进症
english_description: A type of hyperparathyroidism caused by a primary abnormality of the parathyroid glands (e.g., adenoma, carcinoma, hyperplasia). Primary hyperparathyroidism is associated with hyercalcemia.

A reduced level of prolactin in the blood circulation. Prolactin is a protein hormone that is secreted by lactotrophs in the anterior pituitary and that stimulates mammary gland development and milk production.

english_term: Precocious puberty with Sertoli cell tumor
chinese_term: 性早熟伴睾丸支持细胞瘤
胰岛素依赖性非酮症性糖尿病
english_description: Ketosis-resistant diabetes is a synonym for type II diabetes. This term thus refers to a form of type II diabetes in which patients are dependent on insulin.

chinese_term: 原发性肾上腺功能不全
english_description: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.
Hyperplasia of the parathyroid gland.

Amenorrhea due to loss of ovarian function before the age of 40. Primary ovarian inssuficiency (POI) is a state of female hypergonadotropic hypogonadism. It can manifest as primary amenorrhea with onset before menarche or secondary amenorrhea.
Aplasia of the parathyroid gland.

A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).
A reduction below normal concentration of estradiol in the circulation.
Abnormal development of the adrenal gland.
Enlargement of the adrenal gland.

chinese_term: 代偿性甲状腺功能减退症
english_description: Condition associated with a raised serum concentration of thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) but a normal serum free thyroxine (FT4).
Insufficient amount of androgenic activity.

chinese_term: 垂体对甲状腺激素不敏感
english_description: A condition in which the pituitary gland is partially resistant to thyroid hormone, so that it continues to secrete thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) until the blood level of thyroid hormone rises higher than normal.
The presence of lymphangiectasis of the thyroid gland.

chinese_term: 大结节性肾上腺皮质增生症

english_term: Elevated circulating follicle stimulating hormone level
chinese_term: 血液卵泡刺激素水平升高
english_description: An elevated concentration of follicle-stimulating hormone in the blood.
An reduced concentration of progesterone in the blood.

chinese_term: 下丘脑性甲状腺功能减退
english_description: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyrotropin-releasing hormone activity.
Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal medulla.

chinese_term: 继发性生长激素缺乏症

english_description: A state of renal tubular unresponsiveness or resistance to the action of aldosterone.

chinese_term: 先天性肾上腺发育不全
english_description: A type of adrenal hypoplasia with congenital onset.

chinese_term: 垂体性甲状腺功能减退症
english_description: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyroid-stimulating hormone secretion.

chinese_term: 甲状腺功能正常的高甲状腺素血症
english_description: An abnormality of thyroid physiology (HP:0002926) characterized by increased levels of thyroxine without evidence of clinical thyroid disease.
Hyperplasia of the thyroid gland.
Adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors of the adrenal cortex.
A type of adrenal hyperplasia with congenital onset.

chinese_term: 促肾上腺皮质激素受体缺陷
english_description: Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in the ACTH receptor.
The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell.

english_term: Thyroid defect in oxidation and organification of iodide
chinese_term: 甲状腺碘氧化和有机化缺陷

english_description: The presence of intracellular inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in neutrophils. Cytoplasmic neutrophil inclusions (oval, basophilic) are also known as Doehle bodies.

english_term: Increased red cell hemolysis by shear stress
chinese_term: 剪切应力相关的红细胞溶血增加

english_description: Abnormal morphology of collagen fibers in cartilage. In cartilage, collagen II, actually a collagen II:IX:XI heterofibril, is by far the most important type of collagen. A number of abnormalities may be appreciated by electron micrography or biochemical investigations, including sparse collagen fibers in the cartilage matrix.

chinese_term: 光适应视网膜电图异常

english_description: An abnormality of zinc ion homeostasis.
Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellar cortex.
An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood with sudden onset.
An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.
An increased concentration of insulin in the blood in the fasting state, i.e., not as the response to food intake.

chinese_term: 非酮症性高甘氨酸血症
垂体促肾上腺皮质激素腺瘤
english_description: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH).
An increase in the level of long-chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

chinese_term: 短暂性高苯丙氨酸血症
english_description: A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).

chinese_term: 尿液中硫酸皮肤素排泄
english_description: An increased concentration of dermatan sulfate in the urine.
Presence of myoglobin in the urine following exercise.
An increase in the level of medium chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

english_term: Spinal cord posterior columns myelin loss
Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II
chinese_term: 线粒体复合物II活性降低
english_description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.
A decreased concentration of free (unbound) carnitine in the blood.

chinese_term: 肌肉组织中线粒体异常
english_description: An abnormality of the mitochondria in muscle tissue.

chinese_term: 白细胞碱性磷酸酶活性升高
english_description: Increased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

chinese_term: 胶原诱导的血小板凝集障碍
english_description: Abnormal response to collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition collagen or collagen-mimetics.

Reduced activity of coagulation factor X. The extrinsic and intrinsic pathways converge at factor X (fX). The extrinsic pathway activates fX by means of d factor VII with its cofactor, tissue factor. The intrinsic pathway activates fX by means of the tenase complex (Ca2+ and factors VIIIa, IXa and X) on the surface of activated platelets. Factor Xa in turn activates prothrombin (factor II) to thrombin (factor IIa).
Any structural anomaly of the mitochondria.

chinese_term: 异常的明暗适应视网膜电流图
english_description: An abnormality of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.
An abnormally decreased concentration of vitamin B6 in the blood circulation.

chinese_term: 血管性血友病因子活性减低
english_description: Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.
An increased urine level of any amino acid carrying two amino groups (Asparagine, glutamine and lysine, cystine, ornithine).

A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia.

english_term: Elevated plasma branched chain amino acids
chinese_term: 血浆支链氨基酸水平升高
english_description: An increased concentration of a branched chain amino acid in the blood.

english_term: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex IV
chinese_term: 线粒体复合物IV活性降低
english_description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.
A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG2 subclass in the blood circulation.

The presence of an abnormally increased concentration of neutral amino acids in the urine. The neutral amino acids are tryptophan, alanine, asparagine, glutamine, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, phenylalanine, serine, threonine, tyrosine and valine.
Reduced ability to transform factor X into its activated form factor Xa.
Decreased activity of coagulation factor XIII (also known as fibrin stabilizing factor). Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.
An increased concentration of proline in the blood.

chinese_term: 拇趾发育不良/发育不全
english_description: Absence or underdevelopment of the big toe.

chinese_term: 跗骨发育不良/发育不全
english_description: Absence or underdevelopment of the tarsal bones.
An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel.

english_term: Contractures involving the joints of the feet

english_description: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the tarsus (calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, cuneiiform bones).
Nails whose growth is slower than normal.
Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the nail.
An anomaly of the toenail.

english_term: Recurrent loss of toenails and fingernails
english_description: Repeated loss, or shedding, of the nails of the fingers and toes.
The presence of misshapen or partially destroyed nail plates, often with accumulation of soft, yellow keratin between the dystrophic nail plate and nail bed, resulting in elevation of the nail plate.
A thickening of the stratum corneum in the region beneath the nails.
Chronic infection of the nails by Candida species.
A nail of the fifth finger that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail of little finger.
Thickened toenails.
Longitudinal, linear prominences in the fingernail plate.

Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.
Small, underdeveloped vertebral bodies.
The presence of degenerative changes of intervertebral disk.
The presence of punctiform calcification of the bone of the vertebral bodies.
An abnormal shape of the vertebral bodies whereby the vertebral bodies are thick on one side and taper to a thin edge at the other.
Schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.
Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies of the lumbar spine.
An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L1 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

english_term: Absent in utero ossification of vertebral bodies
chinese_term: 在子宫内椎体未发生骨化

english_description: A morphological abnormality of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.
Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the lumbar spine.
Any abnormality of the atlas and the axis.
The presence of one or more herniated nucleus pulposus of intervertebral disk.
Excessive growth of the bones of the vertebral bodies.
An abnormality of the shape of vertebrae, such that they are wedge-shaped (narrow towards the back).
An abnormal narrowing of the cervical spinal canal.

A reduction of the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.

chinese_term: 先天性脊柱后侧凸畸形

english_description: Over curvature of the lumbar region.

A developmental defect of the sacrum characterized by partial or disordered development of the sacrum in which portions of the sacrum, which normally is formed by fusion of five sacral vertebrae S1-S5, fail to form or fail to form normally.
A partial dislocation of the intervertebral joint between the second and third cervical vertebrae.

Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine.

chinese_term: 进行性先天性脊柱侧凸
english_description: A progressive form of scoliosis with congenital onset.
Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the thoracic spine.
An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of sacral vertebrae during development.
Dysplasia of the cervical vertebral column.

chinese_term: 下段胸椎弓根间隙狭窄
english_description: A reduction of the distance between the lower thoracic vertebral pedicles.
Decreased ossification of the cervical vertebral bodies, i.e., of the Cervical vertebrae set.
The presence of arthrosis, i.e., of degenerative joint disease, affecting the cervical vertebral column.
A reduction of the distance between thoracolumbar vertebral pedicles.
Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between lumbar vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column.
Early closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.
Partial displacement of the lens in the inferior direction.

chinese_term: 先天性颅面骨发育不全

english_description: A severe form of hypermetropia with over +5.00 diopters.
Cleft lip or palate affecting the midline region of the palate.

chinese_term: 中度感音神经性听力损失
english_description: The presence of a moderate form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
Reduced transparency of the central posterior portion of the corneal stroma.
A bilateral type of conductive hearing impairment.

english_term: Abnormality of the vertebral spinous processes

chinese_term: 骶骨发育不良/发育不全
english_description: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the sacral bone.
Permanent indentation on the posteromedial aspect of the helix that may be sharply or indistinctly delineated.

chinese_term: 先天性感音神经性听力障碍
english_description: A type of hearing impairment caused by an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve with congenital onset.

english_term: Long hairs growing from helix of pinna

english_description: Absence of the acoustic reflex, an involuntary contraction of the stapedius muscle that occurs in response to high-intensity sound stimuli.

english_term: Cleft at the superior portion of the pinna

english_description: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the low frequencies of sound (125 Hz to 1000 Hz).
Underdevelopment of the external ear.
The presence of a malformed cochlea.
Complete lack of functioning of the vestibular apparatus.
Vestibular areflexia can be measured as the absence of the caloric nystagmus response in electronystagmography.
Median longitudinal length of the ear more than two standard deviations below the mean in the presence of some, but not all, parts of the normal ear.
A malformation of the auricle of the ear.

chinese_term: 低频感音神经性听力障碍
english_description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the lower frequencies.
Underdevelopment of the helix that either affects the entire helix, or is localized.
A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a lesser degree than normal.
Developmental hypoplasia of the cochlea.

chinese_term: 轻度感音神经性听力损失
english_description: The presence of a mild form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

english_term: Slit-like opening of the exterior auditory meatus
english_description: A type of stenosis of the external auditory meatus in which the opening of the external auditory meatus appears as a vertical slit.
Underdevelopment of the helix, i.e., of the outer rim of the pinna.

chinese_term: 先天性传导性听力障碍
english_description: A type of conductive deafness with congenital onset.
Increased anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

chinese_term: 学语后感音神经性听力损失
english_description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with onset after the acquisition of speech.
A mild form of conductive hearing impairment.
Benign congenital lesion of the supraauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

chinese_term: 渐进性传导性听力损失
english_description: A progressive type of conductive deafness.

english_term: Morphological abnormality of the middle ear
english_description: An abnormality of the morphology or structure of the middle ear.

chinese_term: 婴幼儿感音神经性听力损失
english_description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with infantile onset.

chinese_term: 成人感觉神经性听力障碍
english_description: The presence of sensorineural deafness with late onset.

chinese_term: 双侧感音神经性听觉障碍
english_description: A bilateral form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
A severe form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
An abnormality of the stapes, a stirrup-shaped ossicle in the middle ear.

Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation.
Absence of sex glands (gonads are the organs that produce gametes; testis in males and ovary in females).
Abnormal enlargement of the urinary bladder.

Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood.

chinese_term: 女性青春期性发育障碍

english_term: Uric acid urolithiasis independent of gout
chinese_term: 非痛风引起的尿路尿酸结石

english_description: Impotence (inability to develop or maintain an erection) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.
A type of extracapillary glomerulonephritis characterized by the formation of crescent-like cellular proliferation.

chinese_term: 输卵管发育不全/发育不良
english_description: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.
The presence of many cysts in the medulla of the kidney.
A developmental defect characterized by absence or poor development of proximal renal tubules.
Abnormal narrowing of the urethra.
A sarcoma of the kidney.
Hypertrophy of the clitoris.
Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to an unassigned sex differentiation.
Incomplete maturation or aberrant formation of the male gametes.
The presence of calcium- and oxalate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
A developmental disturbance with extreme ureteral dilatation.
Nephrotic syndrome with onset within the first three months of life.
Absence or underdevelopment of the kidney.

Coagulative necrosis of tubular epithelial cells, defined as cells with increased cytoplasmic eosinophilia and nucleus that has a condensed chromatin pattern with fuzzy nuclear contour or has barely visible nuclear basophilic staining. The extent of cortical tubular necrosis is scoredsemiquantitatively as none, mild (less than 25% tubules with necrosis), moderate (25-50 percent), and severe (over 50%).
Increase in size of the folds of skin between the outer labia.

chinese_term: 子宫发育不全/发育不良
english_description: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the uterus.
Absence of both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys.
Developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.
Deposition of calcium salts in gonadal tissue.
Congenital absence of the scrotum.

english_term: Partial development of the penile shaft

english_description: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the urethra.
A unilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.
The presence of a diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urethra.

english_term: Gonadal dysgenesis with female appearance, male
chinese_term: 男性性腺发育不全，女性外表
english_description: Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to a more female sex differentiation.
Developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.
Developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

english_term: Female external genitalia in individual with 46,XY karyotype
chinese_term: 染色体核型为46,XY的个体具有女性外生殖器
english_description: The presence of female external genitalia in a person with a male karyotype.
Renal hypophosphatemia is defined as reduced serum phosphate (e.g., below 0.70 mmol/l) and an inappropriately high renal phosphate excretion.
Reduced volume of the testicle (the male gonad).
The presence of a partially duplicated kidney.
The presence of a longitudinal vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication.
A mild form of hypospadias in which the urethra opens just under the corona glandis.
An abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold.
Ossification affecting the set of cartilages of larynx.
Underdevelopment of the larynx.
Congenital absence of the lumen of the larynx.
Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esopahagus.
A malformation of the laryngeal cartilage.
Absence of the epiglottis.
Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the laryngeal tissues.
Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds.
A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side.
The false perception of sound.

english_term: Self-mutilation of tongue and lips due to involuntary movements
chinese_term: 不自主运动导致舌头和嘴唇自残

english_description: The presence of one or more obsessive-compulsive personality traits. Obsessions refer to persistent intrusive thoughts, and compulsions to intrusive behaviors, which the affected person experiences as involuntary, senseless, or repugnant.
The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the external ear.
Any structural abnormality of the renal artery.

chinese_term: 先天性双侧髋关节脱位

english_description: Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.
Abnormally wide morphology of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
Delayed maturation and calcification of the rami (branches) of the pubic bone.
Irregularities of the iliac crest that produce the appearance of a lace border around it.
Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone.
A cone-shaped deformity of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
A general term that describes a congenital defect in the iliac wing resulting from abnormal development.

english_term: Early ossification of capital femoral epiphyses
chinese_term: 早发性股骨头骨骺骨化
english_description: Developmental acceleration of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a increase in the lateral dimension of the notch.
A decreased ability to move the femur at the hip joint associated with a decreased range of motion of the hip.
Underdevelopment of the lesser trochanter.
Underdevelopment of the femoral head.
Increased width of the femoral head.
The presence of developmental dysplasia of the acetabular part of hip bone.
Increased height of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).
An abnormally flattened femoral head.
Increased size of the ilium ala.
An abnormally reduced diameter of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).
Underdevelopment of the ischiopubic ramus, which is comprised of the inferior pubic ramus and the inferior ramus of the ischium.
Underdevelopment of the body of ilium.
Joint dislocation of the femoral head.

chinese_term: 股骨近端骨骺骨化延迟
english_description: Developmental delay of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
Delayed ossification of the femoral head.
There is normally one ossification center in the head of the femur. This term applies if there are multiple such centers.

chinese_term: 肱骨近端骨骺点状钙化

english_description: Underdevelopment of the bony pelvis.
A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by disproportionate shortening of the medial parts of the extremities (forearm or lower leg).

chinese_term: 严重的胎儿宫内发育迟缓
english_description: Intrauterine growth retardation that is 4 or more standard deviations below average, corrected for sex and gestational age.
A moderate degree of short stature, more than -3 SD but not more than -4 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

chinese_term: 严重的产后生长发育迟缓
english_description: Severely slow or limited growth after birth, being four standard deviations or more below age- and sex-related norms.
A moderate degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between three and four standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.
A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with congenital onset recognizable at birth.

english_term: Failure to thrive secondary to recurrent infections
chinese_term: 反复感染导致发育迟缓
english_description: Insufficient weight gain or inappropriate weight loss for a child, that is attributed to an endogenous recurrent infections.

Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention.
A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short limbs but an average-sized trunk.

chinese_term: 轻度胎儿宫内发育迟缓
english_description: Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 2 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 3 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.
A loss of adipose tissue.
Slow or limited growth after birth.
Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of limbs (i.e. the femur and humerus).

chinese_term: 儿童期发病的躯干肥胖
english_description: Truncal obesity with onset during childhood, defined as between 2 and 10 years of age.
A type of short-limbed dwarfism that is manifest beginning in the neonatal period.

chinese_term: 儿童期发病的短躯干矮小
english_description: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in childhood.

chinese_term: 全身性新生儿肌张力低下
english_description: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature.
Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk.
A generalized form of lymphadenopathy.
An acute form of rhabdomyolysis.
Muscular atrophy of distal leg muscles.

english_term: Loss of ability to walk in early childhood
chinese_term: 幼儿早期行走能力丧失

english_description: Atrophy of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as hip girdle), i.e., the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, the adductors, the psoas major and the iliacus muscle.
Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in infancy.
Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the arms.
Underdevelopment of muscles of the shoulder.
Underdevelopment of the pectoralis major.
Atrophy of the intrinsic muscle groups of the hand, comprising the thenar and hypothenar muscles; the interossei muscles; and the lumbrical muscles.
Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
