Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways.
An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract.
Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection.
Inflammation of the bronchioles.
Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

chinese_term: 肝脏结节性再生性增生
english_description: Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis.
Focal proliferation of glial cells in the substantia nigra.

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.
History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.
An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood.
A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.
Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it.

chinese_term: 血液黄体生成素水平升高
english_description: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.
Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.

An exaggerated whealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor).
Abnormally low glucose concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.
Repeated episodes of sudden-onset and transient lethargy.
Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.

chinese_term: 氨基糖甙类抗生素引起的听力损失
english_description: Partial or complete loss of hearing following ingestion of aminoglycoside antibiotics.
An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine.
An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

chinese_term: 尿香草扁桃酸水平升高
english_description: An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine.
An increased concentration of dopamine in the urine.
Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color.
Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration.
Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment.
Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist.
Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue.
Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue.
Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue.

chinese_term: 中性粒细胞生理功能异常
english_description: A functional abnormality of neutrophils.
A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.
An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.

chinese_term: 中性粒细胞杀菌活性降低
english_description: A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill bacteria.
An abnormality of the interatrial septum.

A bulging of the interatrial septum towards one side. In adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography.

Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.
Abnormally increased level of blood lactate following a meal.
An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal.
A persecutory delusion of supposed hostility of others.
EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.
EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.
Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.
A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before.

english_term: EEG with frontal focal spike waves
chinese_term: 脑电图，伴额叶局灶棘慢波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

english_term: EEG with parietal focal spike waves
chinese_term: 脑电图，伴顶部局灶棘慢波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

chinese_term: 脑电图，伴中央区局灶棘波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.

chinese_term: 脑电图，伴额部局灶棘波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.

chinese_term: 脑电图，伴枕部局灶棘波。
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region.

chinese_term: 脑电图，伴顶部局灶棘波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region.

chinese_term: 脑电图，伴颞区局灶棘波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region.
Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye.
Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.
Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.
Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood.
Increased concentration of ornithine in the blood.
An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx.
A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin.
Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.
Benign neoplasia derived from lipoblasts or lipocytes of white or brown fat. May be angiomatous or hibernomatous.
Presence of a lipoma in the region of the sacrum.

Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities).
Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.
Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor.

Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.

Presence of folds in the Descemet membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descemet membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea.
Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea.
A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction.
Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.

Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.
Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.
Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.
A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.
A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.

A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.
An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.
Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).

chinese_term: 低血清骨化三醇（1,25-二羟基胆钙化醇）
english_description: A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

chinese_term: 低血清骨化二醇（25-羟基胆钙化醇）
english_description: A reduced concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol and 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.

Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented).
Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body.
The presence of a melanoma of the skin.

A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging.

A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed.

chinese_term: 唾液酸化寡聚糖的尿排泄
english_description: Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.
A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone.
Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging.
Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple areas or multiple bones.
Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine.

chinese_term: 天冬氨酰葡萄糖胺尿症
english_description: Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine.
An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.
An increased concentration of chondroitin sulfate (CHEBI:37397) in the urine.
Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.
Excretion of urine with an acid pH, i.e., having an increased hydrogen ion concentration.

An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation.

An abnormality of mental functioning affecting the personality and behavioural tendencies of an individual and characterized by a rigid and unhealthy pattern of thinking and behavior. The definition of a personal disorder implies that the abnormality is not the result of damage or insult to the brain or from another psychiatric disorder.

A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable and capricious mood. Affected individuals show a liability to outbursts of emotion and an incapacity to control the behavioural explosions.
Blockade of impulses at a focal site along the course of a motor axon.
Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.
An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.

chinese_term: 小脑浦肯野细胞层萎缩
english_description: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer.

chinese_term: 泛素阳性的大脑包涵体
english_description: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.

english_term: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
chinese_term: 骨骼肌纤维的大小异常
english_description: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.
An abnormal color of the urine, that is, the color of the urine appears different from the usual straw-yellow color.
An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria.
Arterial inflammation.

chinese_term: 胰腺外分泌生理功能异常
english_description: A functional anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes.

chinese_term: 胰腺内分泌生理功能异常
english_description: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas.
Dislocation of many joints.

english_term: Edema of the dorsum of feet
english_description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet.
An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.

An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.
Atrophy of the parietal cortex.
Atrophy of the occipital cortex.
Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the leg (i.e. the femur).
Increased width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula.
A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,
A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).
Underdevelopment of the pons.
An abnormality of the concentration of corticosterone in the blood.

A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.
A carcinoma of the endometrium, the mucous lining of the uterus.
Inflammation of the liver.
A carcinoma of the larynx.

Abnormally increased levels of methemoglobin in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.
Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine.
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber.
Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid.
A cancer of the prostate.
A cancer arising in any part of the stomach.
Increased concentration of uracil in the urine.
Death of cells in the basal ganglia.

english_term: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells

english_description: Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
An anomaly of cells involved in the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell.

chinese_term: 粒系前体细胞数量异常

english_description: Decreased number of granulocyte precursors in the bone marrow.
A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium.
Any structural anomaly of megakaryocytes. Mature blood platelets are released from the cytoplasm of megakaryocytes, which are bone-marrow resident cells.

english_term: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow

chinese_term: 血管性血友病因子异常
english_description: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

english_term: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
chinese_term: 血管性血友病因子数量减少
english_description: Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor.
Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two or more of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.
Abnormality/dysplasia of a single myeloid cell (erythroid, granulocytic, or megakaryocytic).
The presence of blood in the pleural space.
Splitting of the retinal layers in the macula.
An decrease in the level of triglycerides in the blood.
Reduced ability of the cornea to respond to stimulation.
Phagocytosis by macrophages of erythrocytes, leukocytes, platelets, and their precursors in bone marrow and other tissues.
Atrophy of the cerebral subcortical white and gray matter, termed subcortical atrophy, reflects loss of nerve cells in the basal ganglia or fibers in the deep white matter.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the carotid artery wall.
A separation (dissection) of the layers of the internal carotid artery wall.
A dilatation (balooning or bulging out of the vessel wall) of a carotid artery.
A clinical sign indicating a lapse of posture and is usually manifest by a bilateral flapping tremor at the wrist, metacarpophalangeal, and hip joints.
A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of digits.
Repetitive and compulsive picking of skin which results in tissue damage.
A phenomenon in which persons repetitively pull out their own hair, resulting in noticeable hair loss.
Habitual striking of one's own head against a surface such as a mattress or wall of a crib.
Habitual biting of one's own body.
Habitual biting of one's own fingernails.
Habitual clasping and squeezing of the hands.
Habitual repetitive movement of the body.
An increase in heart rate with standing of 30 beats per minute or more.

A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.

Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay.

chinese_term: 自然杀伤细胞形态异常
english_description: An anomaly of the natural killer cell, which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors. It also regulates immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.

chinese_term: 自然杀伤细胞生理功能异常
english_description: A functional anomaly of the natural killer cell.

chinese_term: 自然杀伤细胞活性降低
english_description: Reduced ability of the natural killer cell to function in the adaptive immune response.

A form of focal dystonia affecting the face and especially the jaw that is induced by the act of speaking. It is an involuntary contraction of the masticatory muscles, resulting in dysarthria or dysphagia.

A disorder of large arteries, in particular the aorta, characterized by an accumulation of basophilic ground substance in the media with cyst-like lesions associated with degenerative changes of collagen, elastin and the vascular smooth muscle cells.
Malfunction of a peripheral nerve resulting from mechanical compression of the nerve roots from internal or external causes and leading to a conduction block or axonal loss.
A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the oropharnyx.
Presence of multiple hyperplastic polyps in the colon. Hyperplastic polyps are generally about 5 mm in size and show hyperplastic mucosal proliferation.
An elevated concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL) in the blood.

Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.

chinese_term: 红细胞原卟啉浓度增高
english_description: An increased concentration of protoporphyrins in erythrocytes.
Excessive vomiting in early pregnancy, leading to the loss of 5% or more of body weight.
A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.
A type of lymphoma that originates in T-cells.
A type of lymphoma that originates in B-cells.
A type of T-cell lymphoma that exhibits malignant infiltration of the skin.
Transient episodes of weakness of the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.

An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes.
A type of tumor of the pancreatic beta cells that secretes excess insulin and can result in hypoglycemia.

The presence of more than 5 juvenile polyps of the colon. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands.
An increase in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.
A fungal infection of the toenails or fingernails that tends to cause the nails to thicken, discolor, disfigure, and split.

chinese_term: 复发性外阴阴道念珠菌病
english_description: Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida.
Any structural anomaly of the acrosome resulting in a round sperm head.
An anomaly of the mobility of ejaculated sperm.
An abnormal reduction in the mobility of ejaculated sperm.
A lack of mobility of ejaculated sperm.

chinese_term: 青少年型粒单核细胞白血病
english_description: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.
Any structural anomaly of the kidney.
An abnormal functionality of the kidney.
An abnormal reduction in the volume of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.
The deposition of calcium phosphate microliths within the seminiferous tubules.
Increased concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine.

A type of soft tissue sarcoma with a histological appearance reminiscent of alveoli because of its reticulated fibrous stroma enclosing groups of sarcoma cells, which resemble epithelial cells and are enclosed in alveoli walled with connective tissue.
An erythematous eruption commonly associated with drug reactions or infection and characterized by inflammatory nodules that are usually tender, multiple, and bilateral.
A type of blistering that affects the skin of the tibial region.
The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the arachnoid.
A breach of the capsule of the spleen.
Narrowing of the urethra associated with inflammation or scar tissue.
An increased white blood cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

A type of retinal detachment arising from damage to the outer blood-retinal barrier that allows fluid to access the subretinal space and separate the neurosensory retina from the retinal pigment epithelium.
Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).
Blood clot formed within muscle tissue following leakage of blood into the tissue.
An increased concentration of chloride in the sweat.
An increased concentration of urocanic acid in the urine.

Increased plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins.
Absence of transferrin, a protein that transports iron, in the blood.

An abnormal increase in intracellular lipid droplets In a muscle. The number and size of these drops can increase with somd disorders of lipid metabolism affecting muscle. See PMID 20691590 for histological images.
Atrophy of the levator palpebrae superioris, the extraocular muscle that elevates the superior eyelid.
Atrophy of the superior rectus, the extraocular muscle whose primary function is to elevate the globe.
A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.
Anomaly of primary or secondary sexual development or characteristics.
Development of the reproductive system is inconsistent with the chromosomal sex.
Reduced ability to control the movement of the eye associated with damage to the third cranial nerve (the oculomotor nerve).
Increased time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex).
An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line.
An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located superior to the isoelectric line.
A structural anomaly of the respiratory system.
A malignant tumor of the bone which always arises in the medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones.

english_term: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
chinese_term: 能动纤毛动力蛋白臂缺陷
english_description: An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

Absence of the inner dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

english_term: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
chinese_term: 运动纤毛轴丝异常排列
english_description: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9+2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.

english_term: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
english_description: Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

english_term: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
chinese_term: 运动纤毛的中央成对微管形态异常
english_description: A structural anomaly of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.

Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions.

english_term: Absent central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
chinese_term: 运动纤毛细胞中央成对微管形态缺失
english_description: Absence of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.
A deviation from the normally well coordinated pattern of intracellular and intercellular synchrony of motile cilia. Dyskinetic cilia usually beat out of synchrony relative to neighboring cilia.
A periodic beat-to-beat variation in the amplitude or shape of the T wave in an EKG.
A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.
Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.
The J wave is a positive convex deflection that occurs at the junction of the QRS complex and ST segment, the J-point.

english_term: Increased carotid artery intimal medial thickness
chinese_term: 颈动脉内膜及中膜增厚
english_description: An increase in the combined thickness of the intima and media of the carotid artery.

english_term: Autosomal dominant inheritance with maternal imprinting
chinese_term: 母源印记基因常染色体显性遗传
english_description: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with maternal silencing.

Inflammation of the flexor digitorum tendon, often associated with the Kanavel signs: (i) finger held in slight flexion, (ii) fusiform swelling, (iii) tenderness along the flexor tendon sheath, and (iv) pain with passive extension of the digit.
An abnormally reduced concentration of glycine in the blood.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.
Reduced concentration of serine in the blood.
A form of amyloidosis that affects the liver.

An exanthema consisting of widespread pink-to-red macules (flat spots of 2-10 mm in diameter) or papules (red bumps) that blanch with pressure. The macules and papules may cluster and merge to form sheets over several days.
Reduced size of the Distal epiphysis of femur.
Reduced size of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.
An abnormal functionality of the hypothalamus.
Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.

chinese_term: 下丘脑促黄体生成素释放激素缺乏
english_description: Decreased secretion of luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone by the hypothalamus.
A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the head and neck region with origin in the lip, oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, or larynx.
Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull.
Reduced diameter of the distal phalanx of finger.
Reduced diameter of the proximal phalanx of finger.
Increased length of the distal phalanx of finger.
Failure of the ureter to undergo development.
Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type II congenital disorder of glycosylation.
A severe virus infection of the central nervous system by the herpes simplex virus (HSV).
An anomaly of the arch of aorta.
Underdevelopment of the arch of aorta.

english_term: Coarctation of the descending aortic arch
english_description: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the descending trunk of arch of aorta.
Ribs that are increased in width and taper to the posterior ends.
A reduced level of the complement component C9 in circulation.
The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.
An increased number of circulating monocytes.
An decreased number of circulating monocytes.
Bony swelling of the distal interphalangeal joint (DIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.
A neoplasm containing histiocytes.
Inflammation of the sacroiliac joint, generally accompanied by lower back pain.
An increased concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.
Inflammation surrounding hair follicles.
A leukemia that originates from a myeloid cell, that is the blood forming cells of the bone marrow.

chinese_term: 慢性粒单核细胞白血病
english_description: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20 percent blasts in the bone marrow and blood, myelodysplasia, and absence of PDGFRA or PDGFRB rearrangement.
An inflammation of the kidney involving the parenchyma of kidney, the renal pelvis and the kidney calices.

chinese_term: 自主神经系统生理功能异常
english_description: A functional abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.
Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in large bile ducts outside the liver.
A reduction in the number of calories used per unit time.
Abnormally reduced concentration of ferritin, a ubiquitous intracellular protein that stores iron, in the blood.
An anomaly of a glycosylation process, i.e., a process involved in the covalent attachment of a glycosyl residue to a substrate molecule.

An anomaly of protein N-linked glycosylation, i.e., an abnormality of the protein glycosylation process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via a nitrogen atom in an amino acid residue in a protein.

english_term: Decreased galactosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
chinese_term: N-联蛋白糖基的半乳糖基化降低
english_description: A reduction in the amount of galactose residues of N-glycans.

An anomaly of protein O-linked glycosylation, i.e., of the process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via the hydroxyl group of a serine or threonine residue.

english_term: Decreased sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
chinese_term: O联蛋白糖基的唾液酸化降低
english_description: An reduced addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.
A decreased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the urine.

Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama).
Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile.
Large or prominent malar surface of the zygomatic bone of the skull, which is convex and forms the prominence of the 'cheek bones'.

Abnormally anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle. The midface includes the maxilla, the cheeks, the zygomas, and the infraorbital and perialar regions of the face
A structural anomaly of the globe of the eye, or bulbus oculi.
A functional anomaly of the eye.
Edema (swelling) of the bulbar conjunctiva.
Abnormal smallness of the lens.
Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes.
A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.
An altered ability of any enzyme or their cofactors to act as catalysts. This term includes changes due to altered levels of an enzyme.

chinese_term: 肉毒碱棕榈酰转移酶活性降低
english_description: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase level, leading to a reduced activity of the reaction: palmitoyl-CoA + L-carnitine = CoA + L-palmitoylcarnitine.
Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right.
Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from both right side of the heart to the left and vice versa.
Inflammation of the nasal mucosa with nasal congestion.
The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers or toes cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.
Aplasia of the hallux, that is, a development defect such that the big toe does not develop.
Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi.
Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs.
A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus.
Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.
An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful.

chinese_term: 早发冠状动脉粥样硬化
english_description: The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta.
An abnormal accumulation of interstitial fluid in the soft tissues of the limbs.

An abnormal concentration of aldolase in the serum. Aldolase is an enzyme responsible for converting fructose 1,6-bisphosphate into the triose phosphates dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.

chinese_term: 尿α-酮戊二酸盐浓度异常
english_description: A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
A greater than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.

chinese_term: 尿α-酮戊二酸盐浓度降低
english_description: A lower than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
A lower than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

A type of spastic paraparetic gait in which the muscle tone in the adductors is marked. It is characterized by hypertonia and flexion in the legs, hips and pelvis accompanied by extreme adduction leading to the knees and thighs hitting, or sometimes even crossing, in a scissors-like movement. The opposing muscles (abductors) become comparatively weak from lack of use.
The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal medulla (innermost part of the kidney).
The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal cortex (the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla).

chinese_term: 纯红细胞再生障碍性贫血
english_description: A type of anemia resulting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction.
The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal.
Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.
An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood.
Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.
Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.
An abnormally low level of blood oxygen.
Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant.
An inflammation of the choroid and retina.

Optic disc drusen are acellular, calcified deposits within the optic nerve head. Optic disc drusen are congenital and developmental anomalies of the optic nerve head, representing hyaline-containing bodies that, over time, appear as elevated, lumpy irregularities on the anterior portion of the optic nerve.

An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.
Protruding heel bone, or calcaneus.

english_term: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebral white matter
chinese_term: 脑白质发育缺陷/发育不全
english_description: Absence or underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.
Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.
Intermittent and recurrent bouts of a subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.
Subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation that persists for six months or longer.
An abnormality of actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others.
A failure to meet one or more age-related milestones of social behavior.
Reduction in length of the ventral (lower) skin of prepuce of penis.
A structural abnormality of the biliary tree.
A structural abnormality of the brain, which has as its parts the forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain.
Partial or complete wasting (loss) of brain tissue that was once present.

chinese_term: 脑脊液5-甲基四氢叶酸降低
english_description: A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.
Any anomaly in the process by which myelin sheaths are formed and maintained around neurons.
Delayed myelination.
Inflammation of the synovial membrane of the sacroiliac joint.
Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation.
A feeling of uneasiness and restlessness in the legs after going to bed (sometimes causing insomnia).
A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.
A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.
Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of medium-sized (muscular or distributive) arteries.
Involuntary and irregular twitches of the chin.
An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.
A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.
An increased level of iron in liver tissues.
Longstanding abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.
Infantile spasms represent a subset of "epileptic spasms". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy).

An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid.
Increased width of the skin of vermilion border region of upper lip.
A turning outward of the lip or lips, that is, eversion of the lips.
Wasting of the tongue.
Complete obstruction of a carotid artery.

chinese_term: 特异性肺炎球菌抗体水平降低
english_description: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci.

A wavering, unsteady voice that reflects involuntary and approximately sinusoidal oscillation of motor unit firings of laryngeal muscles. Vocal tremor results in low frequency modulations of voice frequency or amplitude and intermittent voice instability.
Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.
Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound.
An anomaly of cerebral veins.

Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium, histamine and serotonin.
An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons.
An arachnoid cyst located within the ventricular system.

An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards.
Inflammation of adipose tissue.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of a cerebral artery.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the middle cerebral artery.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the anterior cerebral artery.
Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the posterior cerebral artery.
A decrease in the maximum amount of negative pressure a person can generate during an inhalation.
A decrease in the maximum amount of pressure of expired air achieved by a person after a full inspiration.
A complication of pregnancy and delivery in which the umbilical cord wraps around the fetal neck once or multiple times.

A separation of the layers within the wall of the descending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.
A wartlike (with multiple small elevated projections) papule.

english_term: Abnormality of the brainstem white matter
english_description: An anomaly of the white matter of brainstem.
An anomaly of the pituitary gland.
A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland.
An abnormally increased size of the pituitary gland.
An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland.
Reduced strength of the orbicularis oculi, the circumorbital muscle in the face that closes the eyelid.
A visual anomaly in which images appear distorted. A grid of straight lines appears wavy and parts of the grid may appear blank.

chinese_term: 甲状腺素结合球蛋白降低
english_description: An abnormally decreased amount of thyroxin-binding globulin (TBG) in blood. TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream.
An increased amount of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space.
A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc.

chinese_term: 弥漫性视神经乳头苍白
english_description: A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc.
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm.
An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg.
Reduced ability to flex the femur, that is, to pull the knee upward.
An abnormally decreased amount of catalase level.
An anomaly of the circle of Willis, also known as the cerebral arterial circle.

Increased dimensions of the Virchow-Robin spaces (also known as perivascular spaces), which surround the walls of vessels as they course from the subarachnoid space through the brain parenchyma. Perivascular spaces are commonly microscopic, and not visible on conventional neuroimaging. This term refers to an increase of size of these spaces such that they are visible on neuroimaging (usually magnetic resonance imaging). The dilatations are regular cavities that always contain a patent artery.
Congenital absence of the optic nerve.

A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released.

Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing).
A lack of platelet alpha granules. This typically results in the grey appearance of platelets in giemsa stained blood smears.

A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor.
A deviation from the normal count of alpha granules per thrombocyte.

A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated.
A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte.
An unpleasant sensory and emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage, or described in terms of such damage.
Persistent pain, usually defined as pain that has lasted longer than 3 to 6 months.

Painful sensations elicited by a nonpainful cutaneous stimulus such as a light touch or gentle stroking over affected areas of the body. Sometimes referred to as hyperpathia or hyperalgesia. Often perceived as an intense burning, dyesthesias may outlast the stimulus by several seconds.
A detrimental reaction to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems that is not mediated by an immune reaction.
A detrimental reaction to the presence of gluten in food, which may include abdominal pain, fatigue, headaches and paresthesia, or celiac disease.
A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by the absence of multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.
Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum.
Thickened nails without deformity.
The presence of hemosiderin in the urine.
An increased concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the serum.
An decreased concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the serum.
Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen.
Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers

chinese_term: 中性粒细胞特定颗粒缺乏
english_description: Lack of specific granules in neutrophils.
A thumbnail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped thumb nail.
Absence of thumb nail.
Absent nail of big toe.

english_term: EEG with centrotemporal focal spike waves
chinese_term: 脑电图伴中央颞区棘波
english_description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the centrotemporal region of the brain (also known as the central sulcus), i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.
A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is higher than normal.
First period after the age of 15 years.
A type of mesenchymal tissue cell tumor that exhibits epithelial differentiation, which most frequently arises in the extremities.

Increased numbers of mesangial cells per glomerulus, defined as more than 3 nuclei fully surrounded by matrix in one or more mesangial areas, not including perihilar region, on a standard 3-micron-thick tissue section, best evaluated on periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) stain.

Decreased thickness of the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to a decrease in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations less than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals. May be focal or diffuse, although the term thin GBMs generally implies thinning of over 50% of GBMs.
A type of glomerulonephropathy characterized by thickening of the basement membrane and deposition of immune complexes in the subepithelial space.

chinese_term: 微小病变性肾小球肾炎
english_description: The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.
A bilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.
Two sided hypoplasia of the kidney.
Atrophy of the kidney.
A two-sided form of atrophy of the kidney.
Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine.

chinese_term: 激素耐受性肾病综合征
english_description: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication.
An abnormality in the concentration of electrolytes in the urine.
Increased concentration of albumin in the urine.
Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children.
The presence of moderately increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as and albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) of 30 to 299 mg/gm (3.4 to 34 mg/mmol).
Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults).
Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults).
An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine.
An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine.
An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the urine in the presence of hyponatremia.
An increased concentration of magnesium the urine.
Elevated concentration of urate in the urine.
A cyst located along the allantois canal.
Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.
Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months.
A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2).
A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2).
Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor.

english_term: Abnormal suspensory ligament of lens morphology
chinese_term: 晶状体悬韧带形态异常
english_description: An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place.
Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye.

english_term: Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork
english_description: Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork.
A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye.
Reduction in the amount of blood flow to the iris.
Blockage of the retinal vein.
High urine calcium in the presence of hypocalcemia.

chinese_term: 神经系统生理功能异常
english_description: A functional anomaly of the nervous system.
A structural anomaly of the nervous system.
Cerebellar agenesis is defined by the near complete absence of cerebellar tissue with only remnants of the anterior vermis, flocculus, and/or middle cerebellar peduncles.
Decreased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.
Increase in size of a peripheral nerve. This finding can be appreciated by palpation along the axis of the nerve.

A testis that is located at the upper scrotum or lower inguinal canal and that can be made to descend completely into the scrotum without resistance by manual reduction but returns to its original position by the cremasteric reflex.

Polymicrogyria (an excessive number of small gyri or convolutions) that is maximal in perisylvian regions (the regions that surround the Sylvian fissures), which may be symmetric or asymmetric and may extend beyond perisylvian regions. The Sylvian fissures often extend posteriorly and superiorly.

english_term: Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
chinese_term: 脑FDG正电子发射断层扫描异常
english_description: An anomaly detectable in [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity.
Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
A diminution of the volumetric fraction of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each cardiac cycle.

A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.
Syncope following a quick change in position from lying down to standing.
Poverty of behavior and speech output, lack of initiative, loss of emotional responses, psychomotor slowing, and prolonged speech latency.
Akinetic mutism is essentially characterized by a total absence of spontaneous behavior and speech occurring in the presence of preserved visual tracking.
An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in brain tissue.
An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in the globus pallidus.
An anomalous build up of iron (Fe) in the substantia nigra.
A glial uniloculated or multiloculated fluid-filled sac that either reside within or completely replace the pineal gland.
An abnormal elevation in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.
Failure to develop of the pineal gland, defined clinically as the absence of the pineal gland with no indication of the pineal gland even having been present.

chinese_term: 松果体褪黑素分泌异常
english_description: An anomaly in the amount or timing of melatonin secretion by the pineal gland. Note that melatonin is also synthesized by multiple tissues outside of the pineal gland.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire thalamus.

chinese_term: 丘脑局灶性T2低信号病变
english_description: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.

chinese_term: 丘脑局灶性T2高信号病变
english_description: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
A reduction in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus.

chinese_term: 丘脑核磁共振信号强度异常
english_description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus.
Decreased size of the basal ganglia.
Focal proliferation of glial cells in the cerebellum.
A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the leg.
A functional anomaly of the large intestine.
A sudden, irresistible need to have a bowel movement.
A repeated, painful urge to defecate without excreting stool.
Abnormality in the space in the meninges beneath the arachnoid membrane and above the pia mater that contains the cerebrospinal fluid.
An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater.

english_term: Abnormal metabolic brain imaging by MRS
chinese_term: 通过MRS发现的脑代谢异常
english_description: An anomaly of metabolism in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

english_term: Elevated brain choline level by MRS
english_description: An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

english_term: Elevated brain lactate level by MRS
english_description: An increase in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

english_term: Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
chinese_term: 通过MRS发现N-乙酰天门冬氨酸水平降低
english_description: A decrease in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
The presence of a mild form of hearing impairment.
A profound (essentially complete) form of hearing impairment.
A severe form of conductive hearing impairment.

english_term: Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
english_description: Abnormal structure of the gastrointestinal tract.

english_term: Functional abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
english_description: Abnormal functionality of the gastrointestinal tract.
Tumor (An abnormal mass of tissue resulting from abnormally dividing cells) of the nasal cavity.

A vascular malformation resulting from a developmental error of venous tissue composed of dysmorphic channels lined by flattened endothelium and exhibiting slow turnover. A venous malformation may present as a blue patch on the skin ranging to a soft blue mass. Venous malformations are easily compressible and usually swell in thewhen venous pressure increases (e.g., when held in a dependent position or when a child cries). They may be relatively localized or quite extensive within an anatomic region.
Impaired conduction of cardiac impulse occurring anywhere along the conduction pathway.
Disturbance in the atrial activation that is caused by transient failure of impulse conduction from the sinoatrial node to the cardiac atria.
Edema in the region of the upper eyelid.

A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal or metatarsophalangeal joint of the adjacent digits.
An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.
An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the thoracic aorta.
Absence of the tongue owing to a developmental abnormality.
Abnormal anatomic location of the anterior pituitary gland.
An abnormality of the anus or rectum.
A flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin.
Low blood glucose is accompanied by elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.
A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.
A profound delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
Agenesis of canine tooth.
A tumor of the skin or mucous membrane with finger-like projections.
Absence of a testis from the scrotum on one side owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
Fingernail that appears thin when viewed on end.
Excessive fat around the stomach and abdomen.
Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures.
Toenail that appears thin when viewed on end.

chinese_term: 脑干核磁共振信号强度异常
english_description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem.

chinese_term: 脑干局灶性T2高信号病变
english_description: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.

chinese_term: 脑干局灶性T2低信号病变
english_description: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.

english_term: Abnormal basal ganglia MRI signal intensity
chinese_term: 核磁共振基底节异常信
english_description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia.

english_term: Focal T2 hypointense basal ganglia lesion
chinese_term: 基底节局灶性T2低信号病变
english_description: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.
A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting all of the basal ganglia.
A structural anomaly of a neuron.
A deviation from normal of the neurological development of a child, which may include any or all of the aspects of the development of personal, social, gross or fine motor, and cognitive abilities.

A reduced ability to participate in the back and forth flow of social interaction, which is normally characterized by an influence of the behavior of one person on the behavior of another person who is in conversation with the first.
The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebral white matter.
A sudden attack of dyspnea that occurs while the affected person is at rest.
A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing.

chinese_term: 增宽的小脑蛛网膜下腔
english_description: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebellum.
An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum.
Respiratory failure in the newborn.

Decreased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

Increased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

english_term: Reduced upper to lower segment ratio
english_description: Decreased ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis. Consider the term Disproportionate tall stature (HP:0001519) if tall stature is also present.

english_term: Increased upper to lower segment ratio
english_description: Elevated ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.
A lacy pattern or iris pigmentation that resembles the spokes of a bicycle wheel.

chinese_term: 视网膜星形细胞错构瘤
english_description: A glial tumor of the retinal nerve fiber layer arising from a retinal astrocyte.
Chronic loss of joint motion in a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
Repeated infections of the urinary bladder.
Repeated episodes of pyelonephritis.

chinese_term: 口腔黏膜网状色素沉着
english_description: A net-like pattern of increased pigmentation of the oral cavity.
Underdevelopment of the heel bone.
A kinked appearance of the brainstem, i.e., an exaggerated flexure.
Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.
A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefore may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.

Infiltration of smooth muscle-like cells in lymph vessels as well as the lung (pleura, alveolar septa, bronchi, pulmonary vessels and lymphatics as well as lymph nodes, especially in posterior mediastinum and retroperitoneum). Focal emphysema can develop because of airway narrowing, and the thoracic duct may be obliterated. Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis may lead to multiple small cysts with a hamartomatous proliferation of smooth muscle in their walls.
One-sided weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.

Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparently decreased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).
Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 SD above the mean (objective); or an apparently increased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).
Inequality of refractive power of the two eyes.
Disruption of the epithelial layer of the cornea with involvement of the underlying stroma.
Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris.
A fleshy, tube-like structure usually located in the midline of the face or just to one side of the midline.
Decreased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
Increased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
Increased width of the nasal ridge.
Underdevelopment of the breast on one side only.
Underdevelopment of the breast on both sides.

chinese_term: 女性外生殖器发育不良
english_description: Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).
A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber.
Inflammation of the myocardium.
The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels.
A benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

chinese_term: 部分性癫痫发作持续状态
english_description: Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years).

Abnormal small intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.
Hepatic fibrosis that reaches from a portal area to another portal area.
Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the middle of the inferior shaft of the penis.
Increased pigmentation (skin color) of the scrotum.
Anomaly of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.
Formation of excess connective tissue in the testicle.
A gonad that contains both ovarian follicles and testicular tubular elements.

chinese_term: 男性生殖细胞形态异常
english_description: A structural anomaly of a male reproductive cell.
A structural anomaly of sperm.
A structural abnormality of the sperm head.
A structural abnormality of the sperm mid-piece.
A structural abnormality of the sperm tail.
Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head.

A condition which is considered to be due to the subsequent atrophy and disappearance in fetal life of an initially normal testis. In the presence of spermatic cord structures is evidence of the presence of the testis in early intrauterine life. When associated with a blind-ending spermatic cord, this entity is named as his absence of a testis in an otherwise normal 46XY male is usually unilateral and is assumed to be a consequence of intrauterine or perinatal torsion or infarction.

A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum.
Aplasia (congenital absence) of the vas deferens.
The emission of semen and seminal fluid into the bladder instead of through the penis during orgasm.
An anomaly of the outer labia.
Overgrowth of the outer labia.
An abdominal mass formed by bleeding into a follicular ovarian cyst or corpus luteum cyst.
A cystic tumor of the ovary, containing thin, clear, yellow serous fluid and varying amounts of solid tissue.
An anomaly of the neck of the uterus (lower part of the uterus), called the uterine cervix.
Posterior malposition of the anus.
Hypertrophy of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
Muscle hypertrophy affecting the muscles of the neck.

An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs). MEPs are measured following single-pulse or repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation and can be used for the assessment of the excitability of the motor cortex and the integrity of conduction along the central and peripheral motor pathways.

chinese_term: 下肢运动诱发电位异常
english_description: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the leg.
Difficulty releasing one's grip associated with prolonged first handgrip relaxation times.
Slowed relaxation of muscles in the face.
Slowed relaxation of muscles in the jaw.
Slowed relaxation of muscles in the leg.
Slowed relaxation of muscles in the arm.
An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation that is induced by exposure to cold.

Euryblepharon is a congenital eyelid anomaly characterized by horizontal enlargement of the palpebral fissure. The eyelid is shortened vertically compared with the horizontal dimension, with associated lateral canthal malpositioning and lateral ectropion abnormally wide lid opening.
A coloboma of the ciliary body.
A spatial pattern that is spread out, i.e., not localized.
A lack of coordination of leg movement manifested by undershoot or overshoot of the intended position of the leg.
A lack of coordination of arm movement manifested by undershoot or overshoot of the intended position of the arm.
A postural abnormality characterized by the inability to stand without external support despite having sufficient muscle strength.

chinese_term: 椎基底动脉扩张延长症
english_description: Elongation, dilatation, and/or tortuosity of the vertebrobasilar segment. The definition of VBD includes: (i) diameter of basilar or vertebral artery over 4.5 mm; or (ii) deviation of any portion more than 10 mm from the shortest expected course; and (iii) length of basilar artery over 29.5 mm or length of intracranial vertebral artery over 23.5 mm.
A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate nasally.
A form of esotropia (convergent deviation of the eyes) associated with activation of the accommodative reflex.
A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate temporally.
An abnormal elevation above the normal number of red blood cells per volume in the circulation.
Any deviation from the normal concentration of hemoglobin in the blood.
An abnormal reduction below normal hemoglobin concentration in the circulation.
An abnormal elevation above normal hemoglobin concentration in the circulation.
Persistent presence of Epstein-Barr virus in the blood.
A white or lighter patch of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by decreased skin pigmentation.
The presence of crystals in the urine.
Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of substances in red blood cells.

A type of erythrocyte inclusion characterized by basophilic stippling of erythrocytes, that is, by numerous very small coarse or fine blue granules within the cytoplasm with the additional stipulation that the stippled particles are due to iron granules (demonstrable by the Prussian blue stain).
A type of erythrocyte inclusion composed of denatured hemoglobin.
An infection of a hair follicle that extends subcutaneously, forming an abscess.

chinese_term: 接种卡介苗后局部或周边感染
english_description: Local or regional infection with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination.

chinese_term: 接种卡介苗后远处或播散性感染
english_description: Distant, or disseminated infection with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination associated with failure to contain thebacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination leading to spread of BCG to many sites in the body. The tuberculosis vaccine BCG contains live attenuated Mycobacterium bovis.

chinese_term: 接种麻疹减毒活疫苗后感染
english_description: Infection with the measles virus of the live-attenuated vaccine. This is an extremely rare event and may indicate immunocompromise in some cases.
Increased susceptibility to streptococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of streptococcal infections.

An opportunistic disease caused by invasion of unicellular fungus Pneumocystis jirovecii. Transmission of P. jirovecii cysts takes place through the airborne route, and usually, its presence in lungs is asymptomatic. However, people with impaired immunity, especially those with CD4+ T cell count below 200/microliter, are still at risk of the development of Pneumocystis pneumonia due to P. jirovecii invasion. Symptoms induced by this disease are not specific: progressive dyspnoea, non-productive cough, low-grade fever, arterial partial pressure of oxygen below 65 mmHg, and chest radiographs demonstrating bilateral, interstitial shadowing.

Toxoplasmosis is a widespread parasitic infection that is frequently asymptomatic in immunocompetent patients. However, this obligate intracellular protozoan parasite can evade the immune system and persist for the life of its host in cyst form, predominantly in the brain, retina, and muscles. Reactivation of latent cysts may occur when the immune system fails to maintain cytokine pressure, which mainly relies on gamma interferon (IFN-gamma). Toxoplasmosis is a life-threatening infection in immunocompromised patients (ICPs).
A partial or complete breakage of the continuity of a bone.

english_term: Decreased proportion of CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells
english_description: An abnormally decreased proportion of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells in circulation, relative to another population of cells.

chinese_term: 持续性人乳头瘤病毒感染
english_description: Human papillomaviruses (HPVs) are small oncogenic viruses. HPV has been shown to cause a variety of lesions and malignancies, which predominantly affect the anogenital region. Low-risk, non-oncogenic HPV types are associated with anogenital warts and recurrent respiratory papillomatosis while high-risk, oncogenic types are associated with cervical, penile, anal, vaginal, vulvar, and oropharyngeal cancers. Infection with anogenital HPV is usually asymptomatic and resolves spontaneously without consequences in the immunocompetent host. When disease does occur, the most common manifestation is genital warts, which may be small papules, or flat, smooth or pedunculated lesions. This resolution of HPV lesions is not generally seen in the immunosuppressed, resulting in severe, persistent and extensive manifestations of HPV disease.

chinese_term: 真皮表皮交界处半小体发育不良
english_description: Underdeveloped hemidesmosomes at the dermoepidermal junction. Hemidesmosomes are the specialized junctional complexes, that contribute to the attachment of epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane in stratified and other complex epithelia, such as the skin.
Congenital absence of the radial artery.

english_term: Abnormal retinal nerve fiber layer morphology
chinese_term: 视网膜神经纤维层形态异常
english_description: A structural abnormality of the retinal nerve fiber layer
Swelling (edema) of the retinal nerve fibers.
Red blood cells that appear to have parts of them bitten away.
A stiffening of the tympanic membrane due to calcification, typically presents as white plaque-like lesions, involving discrete regions of the tympanic membrane and/or middle ear.

A lump detected in the region that surrounds a joiny. In this context, mass is a general term for a lump or growth that may be caused by the abnormal growth of cells, a cyst, hormonal changes, or an immune reaction.

english_term: Thickening of the tubular basement membrane
english_description: Increase in thickness of the basement membrane of the tubulus of the kidney.

A mesenchymal neoplasm characterized by solitary or multiple nodules involving the skin, striated muscles, bones and, sometimes, viscera. It usually appears as a subcutaneous nodule, but can also appear as an ulcer, pedunculated lesion, or similar to a hemangioma.
